Definition: A cell is the smallest part of a living thing that can live by itself.
Example: A red blood cell carries oxygen.

Definition: A cigarette is a thinly wrapped paper tube filled with tobacco that is smoked.
Example: Cigarette smoking is terrible for your health.

Definition: A code is a set of symbols used to hide or read a message.
Example: She used the code to solve the puzzle.

Definition: A cure is a medical treatment to make a sickness go away.
Example: Scientists are still working on finding a cure for diabetes.

Definition: To damage something is to cause its destruction.
Example: The wildfires left the forest in a state of destruction.

Definition: DNA is the short form of deoxyribonucleic acid.
Example: The police sometimes use DNA to solve crime.

Definition: Extensive means large in size or amount.
Example: The game drew extensive media coverage.

Definition: Female refers to women or girls.
Example: She is the only female student in her class with short hair.

Definition: Furthermore means more information will be added.
Example: She’s clever, and furthermore, she is not afraid of work.

Definition: A gene controls what it looks like, how an organism grows, and how it develops.
Example: Gene therapy is sometimes used to treat an illness.

Definition: To inherit is to receive something that is passed down from a relative.
Example: All the girls in my family inherit red hair from my great-grandmother.

Definition: A link is a connection to something else.
Example: The two lines in the poem share a common link.

Definition: Male refers to men or boys.
Example: He was the only male in the store.

Definition: A population is all the people living in an area.
Example: The population of our city is steadily growing.

Definition: A result happens because of something else.
Example: The result of her experiment was surprising.

Definition: Sugar comes from plants and is used to make food taste sweet.
Example: She added extra sugar to her tea.

Definition: To accommodate is to have enough room.
Example: The meeting room can accommodate nine people.

Definition: A circus is a traveling show with animals and people.
Example: I like to go to the circus to see the animals do tricks.

Definition: To coincide means to happen at the same time.
Example: My birthday coincides with Christmas.

Definition: To commission someone is to pay that person to do some job.
Example: The artist was commissioned to create a picture.

Definition: A dose is a certain amount of medicine taken at one time.
Example: My mother gave me a dose of medicine before I went to bed.

Definition: To dye something is to make it a certain color by using a special chemical.
Example: Valery got her hair dyed at the salon yesterday.

Definition: The extent of something is how large, important, or serious it is.
Example: He ate to such an extent that he became overweight.

Definition: Gender is a category that describes being either a boy or a girl.
Example: Do you know the gender of her new baby?

Definition: A headline is the title of a newspaper story.
Example: The headline on the front page was about the economy.

Definition: An informal thing is casual and relaxed, not official.
Example: They had an informal meeting to talk about their experiences.

Definition: To inquire about something is to ask about it.
Example: Dad called to inquire about the price of tickets for the show.

Definition: A messenger is one who carries information from one place to another.
Example: The messenger delivered an important document to the office.

Definition: To peer at something is to watch it carefully.
Example: She peered at people through the window.

Definition: A portrait is a painting or photograph of someone.
Example: I saw many religious portraits when I went to the museum.

Definition: To pose is to stay in one place without moving.
Example: The kids and their dog posed for a picture.

Definition: A ranch is a large farm where animals are kept.
Example: My uncle has many horses on his ranch.

Definition: To steer something is to control where it goes.
Example: He steered the go-cart around the track.

Definition: A stripe is a thick line.
Example: The flag of the United States has red and white stripes.

Definition: A tame animal is not afraid to be near people.
Example: The tame bird rested in his hand.

Definition: To tempt people is to offer them something they want but shouldn’t have.
Example: I wasn’t hungry, but she tempted me with a piece of my favorite cake.

Definition: To ban something is to not let people do it.
Example: Smoking is banned in this building.

Definition: A cautious person is careful to avoid danger.
Example: Be very cautious as you stack those boxes.

Definition: To confess is to admit a bad or embarrassing truth.
Example: The woman confessed that she had stolen the money.

Definition: A cottage is a small, old house in the countryside.
Example: My aunt lives in a pretty cottage in the mountains.

Definition: Daytime is the time of the day when the sky is light.
Example: The kids are only allowed to play outside in the daytime.

Definition: A desperate person will try anything to do or change something.
Example: I’m desperate to find a new job.

Definition: An exhausting activity is very tiring.
Example: After an exhausting journey, we finally arrived.

Definition: To fade is to become quieter or less bright.
Example: The piece of cloth I found was old and faded.

Definition: A fierce person or animal is angry or violent.
Example: Wolves are fierce animals. Do not disturb them.

Definition: To gamble means to play a game that involves winning or losing money.
Example: Many people like to go to casinos to gamble.

Definition: A lawn is an area covered in grass.
Example: My dad keeps the lawn in front of our house very neat.

Definition: To mow grass is to cut it to make it short.
Example: I mow our lawn every weekend.

Definition: An outlaw is a criminal who hides from the police.
Example: The police passed out posters of the outlaw to all the people.

Definition: A prospect is a possibility that something will happen.
Example: He wakes up every morning with the prospect of having a good day.

Definition: A purse is a bag in which women keep money, makeup, keys, etc.
Example: My sister likes to buy designer purses.

Definition: A rod is a thin stick made of wood or metal.
Example: I bought a new fishing rod to use while on vacation.

Definition: Seldom shows that an action doesn’t happen very often.
Example: It seldom rains in southern Arizona.

Definition: To shave means to cut the hairs on one’s face with a sharp tool.
Example: My father shaves his face every day because he doesn’t want a beard.

Definition: A terrified person or animal is extremely scared.
Example: When I saw the ghost, I was absolutely terrified!

Definition: A wizard is a man who can do magic.
Example: The wizard made gold fall from the sky.

Definition: An action done abroad is done in a different country.
Example: My friend is going on a summer trip abroad.

Definition: An airline is a company that takes people to different places by plane.
Example: The airline has excellent customer service.

Definition: An audience is a group of people who gather to watch someone do something.
Example: He was excited to be part of the audience.

Definition: A bargain is a very good price paid for a product.
Example: She was looking forward to getting a good bargain at the supermarket.

Definition: A brief action lasts a short time.
Example: The lawyers took a brief break.

Definition: The currency of a country is the type of money used in that country.
Example: The currency in China is different from that in Australia.

Definition: Data is a collection of information and facts.
Example: He saved all the data on his computer.

Definition: Domestic refers to something that happens within a particular country.
Example: The airline has fifty domestic flights daily.

Definition: A draft is a piece of written work that is not in its final form.
Example: He was writing his first draft.

Definition: To gather is to form a group or bring together.
Example: We will gather the children before the meeting.

Definition: A hobby is a fun and creative activity people do in their free time.
Example: She liked to paint as a hobby.

Definition: An income is the money you earned from work.
Example: She was saving her income to buy a house.

Definition: A jet is a fast plane with a big engine.
Example: Her company owns a private jet.

Definition: Maximum is the highest amount of anything allowed.
Example: The maximum driving speed here is 80 km/h.

Definition: An official thing is approved by someone in authority.
Example: Her official degree was being transferred.

Definition: To recommend means to give advice based on experience.
Example: His doctor will recommend the best medicine for her cough.

Definition: To refer to something means to mention or call attention to it.
Example: Mr. Cid referred to the time to show Bill that he was late for class.

Definition: A remote place is distant or far away.
Example: He lived in a remote village in the Himalayas.

Definition: Sleepless describes a time period in which someone does not sleep.
Example: Jill had a sleepless night because she had so much on her mind.

Definition: The volume is the total amount of something.
Example: The volume of cars in the parking lot was steadily increasing.

Definition: To circulate is to spread something around, especially in a circular way.
Example: The fan helped to circulate cool air through the room.

Definition: Consequent means happening because of a different situation.
Example: Her consequent rash came after she touched the poisonous plant.

Definition: To derive means to come, or originate, from a thing or place.
Example: Red’s nickname was derived from the color of her hair.

Definition: To drown is to die from not being able to breathe underwater.
Example: He would have drowned if the sailors had not rescued him.

Definition: A dynasty is a series of rulers who are all from the same family.
Example: The ancient Egyptians had a dynasty that lasted for many years.

Definition: A fraction is a small part of something.
Example: Only a fraction of the cake was gone.

Definition: Frost is a white layer of ice that forms during very cold weather.
Example: In the morning, the trees were all covered with frost.

Definition: An illusion is something that looks real, but doesn’t actually exist.
Example: Some pictures create an illusion for the eyes.

Definition: To invade is to take over a place by force.
Example: The enemy forces tried to invade our country from the sky.

Definition: A lieutenant is a rank in the military or police, or a person with that rank.
Example: The lieutenant was a good leader, and his soldiers respected him.

Definition: Marine describes something related to the sea.
Example: A healthy ocean is full of marine animals.

Definition: A merit is a positive or good quality.
Example: The actor received an award for his merits in the movie.

Definition: A navy is the part of a country’s military that fights at sea.
Example: My country is known for our strong navy.

Definition: Polar relates to the cold places on Earth’s north and south ends.
Example: Only a few people live in the Earth’s northern polar region.

Definition: A ray is a line of light that comes from a bright object.
Example: The sun’s warm rays covered the beach.

Definition: To resign means to quit a job.
Example: After I officially resigned from work, I said goodbye to my boss.

Definition: Suicide is the act of killing oneself.
Example: Some people feel so sad that they think suicide is the only answer.

Definition: To tremble is to shake as a result of excitement or cold weather.
Example: Harry was not used to the cold, so he trembled most of the day.

Definition: An underlying thing is a hidden cause or reason.
Example: Her underlying fear of flying reduced her traveling options.

Definition: Via introduces a route or means of travel.
Example: We arrived in the city from the airport via the train.

Definition: To alter something means to change it.
Example: I altered the color of my nails to match my hair.

Definition: An action done aside is done toward the side of something or someplace.
Example: The man stood aside and opened the door for me.

Definition: Autumn is the season of the year between summer and winter.
Example: I love when the leaves fall in autumn because I can play in them.

Definition: To blend is to mix two or more things together so that they become one thing.
Example: My wife blended together all of the ingredients to make a delicious stew.

Definition: To collapse is to fall down suddenly.
Example: The tree collapsed right in front of our house.

Definition: To crush something is to press it together so its shape is destroyed.
Example: Selena’s new car was crushed when the tree fell on top of it.

Definition: To curve is to move in a line that bends and does not go straight.
Example: The road curves to the left and to the right.

Definition: A disgusting thing is very unpleasant.
Example: After running all day, Greg’s feet had a disgusting odor.

Definition: A drain is a pipe that carries away water from a building, such as in a kitchen
Example: .The water in the sink goes down the drain as you wash your hands.

Definition: To embrace is to hug.
Example: When they saw each other again, the happy couple embraced.

Definition: To envy someone is to wish that you had something that other person has.
Example: Sally envied the happy couple.

Definition: Fireworks are objects that create colored lights when they are lit.
Example: The display of fireworks was so beautiful.

Definition: Flour is a powder made from plants that is used to make foods like bread.
Example: I wanted to bake a pie, but I needed flour.

Definition: A fuse is a string on fireworks that burns to make them explode.
Example: The boy lit the fuse on the rocket and waited for it to burst in the sky.

Definition: Ginger is a root of a plant that is used to make food spicy and sweet.
Example: Ginger is a common ingredient in many dishes from India.

Definition: A jealous person might take something from you.
Example: Miriam was jealous because Sue was paying too much attention to Jim.

Definition: A paste is a thick and smooth substance.
Example: My son needed some paste for a school project.

Definition: A receipt is a paper that proves that something was received or bought.
Example: After looking at my receipt, I realized that I had spent too much money.

Definition: To wipe something is to slide a piece of cloth over it to clean it.
Example: She wiped the dust from the windows.

Definition: A wire is a thin string made out of metal.
Example: The wires were connected to towers that brought electricity to the city.

Definition: To acknowledge something is to accept that it is true or that it exists.
Example: The teacher acknowledged that the young student was hungry.

Definition: An ambassador is a government worker who works in another country.
Example: The ambassador from Korea was in charge of the conference.

Definition: A blonde is a person with light-colored hair.
Example: My cousin is a blonde with blue eyes.

Definition: To conquer a place means to attack and take control of it.
Example: The soldiers were trying to conquer the world.

Definition: To drag something means to pull it across the ground.
Example: The dog was dragging his owner down the street.

Definition: To exaggerate is to say that something is bigger or better than it really is.
Example: Jimmy wasn’t exaggerating about the seriousness of his injury.

Definition: Heritage is the collection of features of a society, such as language and religion.
Example: Teepees are part of the heritage of the Native Americans of the plains.

Definition: To insult someone is to say things that will hurt the person’s feelings.
Example: The girls insulted each other all afternoon.

Definition: An action that happens meanwhile happens at the same time as another action.
Example: He wants to be a doctor in the future, but meanwhile, he works a regular job.

Definition: A necklace is a piece of jewelry that people wear around their necks.
Example: Joyce received a lovely pearl necklace for her wedding anniversary.

Definition: A noble is a rich and powerful person.
Example: The Queen invited a noble from a nearby country to dinner.

Definition: A precious thing is valuable and important.
Example: In a desert, water can be more precious than money.

Definition: A prejudice is an unfair opinion about people based on the group they belong to.
Example: The company’s rules against gender prejudice must be enforced.

Definition: A rumor is a story that may not be true.
Example: Carla was spreading rumors around the office.

Definition: A sin is something that is wrong for religious reasons.
Example: Taking something that doesn’t belong to you is a sin.

Definition: A spectacle is an amazing sight.
Example: Niagara Falls is quite a spectacle.

Definition: A stack is a pile of different things.
Example: There was a stack of paperwork on his desk to complete.

Definition: A suspicious person does not trust others, or is not trusted by others.
Example: Dad was suspicious of the caller on the line.

Definition: Tin is an inexpensive metal.
Example: Soup is a food that is often sold in tin cans.

Definition: A vase is an attractive container in which people keep flowers.
Example: The vase was filled with such lovely flowers.

Definition: To ache is to hurt, or cause pain.
Example: Mindy’s head ached because she bumped it against the wall.

Definition: Arctic shows that something is of or from the cold, far-north part of the Earth.
Example: It is cold when the arctic winds blow.

Definition: A canal is a path for water to travel through.
Example: The city of Venice, Italy, has many canals.

Definition: A chemist is a scientist who works with chemicals.
Example: My mother is a successful chemist who helps invent new products.

Definition: A chill is a feeling of cold.
Example: The chill from the cold wind made Bill shiver.

Definition: Congress is a group of leaders in a government.
Example: Congress makes laws for people to follow.

Definition: Dairy shows that something is made from milk.
Example: Things like milk and cheese are dairy foods.

Definition: To descend is to go downward.
Example: I descended the stairs to get out of the building.

Definition: A grocer is a person who sells food.
Example: Our grocer, Mr. Smith, is a very kind man.

Definition: To hesitate is to wait for a short time before doing something.
Example: He hesitated for a moment before he decided which one to choose.

Definition: An institution is an organization that works to help a city or group of people.
Example: Banks are vital institutions that businesses and people use every day.

Definition: To jog is to run slowly.
Example: He jogs every day so he can be healthier.

Definition: A merchant is a person who sells things.
Example: The merchant was selling used cars.

Definition: To poke something is to push something quickly with your finger or a pointed object.
Example: I poked my finger on a thumb tack.

Definition: To postpone something is to make it happen later than planned.
Example: They postponed the meeting until Elena arrived.

Definition: To splash is to crash into something so that liquid spreads out.
Example: Some green paint splashed upon the floor.

Definition: Stubborn people don’t change their minds easily.
Example: Both of my parents are stubborn. They never give in to each other.

Definition: A suburb is a small part of a large city.
Example: I grew up in the suburbs, only a few minutes outside of the city.

Definition: The tide is the level of the water in the sea.
Example: The tide continued to crawl upon the beach little by little.

Definition: A tragedy is a very sad event.
Example: It was a tragedy when his house was struck by lightning and burned.

Definition: A bomb is an object that explodes and destroys large areas.
Example: The bomb will destroy anything that is nearby.

Definition: A certificate is a document that says that something is true or happened.
Example: I was given a certificate for completing the computer course.

Definition: A circumstance is an event that makes a situation what it is.
Example: There were many circumstances behind their success, like hard work.

Definition: A coffin is a box used to bury dead people.
Example: When people pass away, they are usually buried inside of a coffin.

Definition: To cope with a difficult or stressful situation means to deal with it.
Example: He copes with work stress by exercising three or four times a week.

Definition: Criticism is the act of saying that something is not correct or good.
Example: She had a lot of criticism about their new plan.

Definition: To devastate something is to cause great damage or pain to that thing.
Example: The entire wall was devastated.

Definition: To frown is to make an unhappy look with one’s face.
Example: Melissa frowned when she found out that the party had been cancelled.

Definition: To gaze at something means to look at it for a long time.
Example: We used a telescope to gaze at the stars for over an hour.

Definition: To glance at something means to look at it quickly.
Example: She glanced behind her to see if he was looking at her.

Definition: Grief is the feeling of deep sadness, usually when a person dies.
Example: The grief caused by losing her parents was very difficult for her.

Definition: A groom is a man who is going to be married.
Example: The groom looked happy as he walked with his new wife.

Definition: A license is an official document that gives one permission to do something.
Example: In the United States, you need a driver’s license to drive legally.

Definition: A microscope is a device that makes small objects look bigger.
Example: Germs cannot be seen without a microscope.

Definition: A nuclear thing relates to the division or joining of atoms.
Example: Nuclear power plants provide inexpensive energy to cities.

Definition: To portray something means to describe it or show it in a picture.
Example: Her picture portrayed the house she grew up in when she was little.

Definition: To rotate something means to turn it around in a circle.
Example: An airplane’s propellers rotate quickly to help it fly.

Definition: A souvenir is something bought to remember of a place or event.
Example: I bought a Russian doll as a souvenir on my trip to Moscow.

Definition: A submarine is a boat that can go underwater for long periods of time.
Example: The submarine dove under the sea so the enemy couldn’t see it.

Definition: To trace something means to follow over it with the eyes or a finger.
Example: He traced over the graph with his finger.

Definition: A coastline is the outline of a country’s coast.
Example: He noticed that most of the cities in Australia are on the coastline.

Definition: To deter means to prevent or discourage someone from doing something.
Example: Icy roads deter people from driving their cars.

Definition: To devise something means to come up with an idea or plan about it.
Example: The thieves devised a plan to steal the diamonds.

Definition: A distance is how far it is between two points.
Example: The distance between America and Russia is about 8,000 km.

Definition: Expertise is the knowledge and skills to do something well.
Example: John has a lot of advertising expertise. He can sell anything!

Definition: A fracture is a crack or break in something.
Example: Don’t stand on that leg because there is a fracture. It might get worse.

Definition: A headache is a pain in one’s head.
Example: My sister gets a headache every time she has a lot of stress.

Definition: To implement something means to ensure that what has been planned is done.
Example: The school decided to implement a new teaching strategy.

Definition: Insight is a deep and accurate understanding of something.
Example: The physics textbook gave the student a new insight about gravity.

Definition: A limb is a large branch on a tree.
Example: The monkey sat on the tree limb and enjoyed a piece of fruit.

Definition: Might means strength or power.
Example: Try with all your might to lift the heavy tire.

Definition: Optimism is the state of being hopeful about the future.
Example: The mother had optimism about her children’s futures.

Definition: Proficient means able to do something well.
Example: Secretaries are proficient at typing quickly.

Definition: A raft is a flat kind of boat.
Example: He sailed across the Pacific Ocean on a raft.

Definition: A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land.
Example: The brown bear walked along the edge of the mountain ridge.

Definition: A shoulder is the body part between the top of the arm and the neck.
Example: He carried his bike on his shoulder.

Definition: To shove something is to push it with a lot of power.
Example: She shoved him out of the way.

Definition: A spouse is the person to whom someone is married.
Example: I live in a home with my spouse and our two children.

Definition: To thrust means to push or move something quickly with a lot of force.
Example: The boxer thrust his fist into the punching bag.

Definition: To tolerate something means to be able to accept it even when it is unpleasant.
Example: When you are in a hurry, it can be hard to tolerate traffic signals.

Definition: When someone is accountable, he or she is responsible for the effects of his or her actions.
Example: Political leaders are accountable to the people they represent.

Definition: If something is addictive, it is hard to stop doing.
Example: I think this game is very addictive.

Definition: An agenda is a plan or goal that guides someone’s behavior.
Example: The man is pushing his questionable agenda on his colleagues.

Definition: To coin is to create a new word or phrase that other people begin to use.
Example: The coach coined the phrase, “There is no ‘I’ in team.”

Definition: To correlate is to have a close connection to something.
Example: Scientists believe that brain size might correlate with intelligence.

Definition: Depression is a medical condition that makes a person very unhappy for long periods of time.
Example: Ron decided to get help for his depression.

Definition: When something is digital, it is characterized by computer technology.
Example: Students prefer to take notes on their laptops and other digital devices.

Definition: Importance is the quality or state of being important, valuable, or significant.
Example: The professor lectured the students on the importance of communication strategies.

Definition: A keyboard has buttons marked with letters and numbers that are pressed to put information into a computer.
Example: Paul spilled coffee all over his keyboard.

Definition: Loneliness is the unhappiness that is felt by someone if they do not have any friends.
Example: Many people join social clubs to escape loneliness.

Definition: Media is the different ways of entertaining and giving information to the public.
Example: Many people like to express their opinions online using social media.

Definition: A platform is something that allows someone to tell a large number of people about an idea, product, etc.
Example: The band uses their music as a platform to express their political beliefs.

Definition: When something is poor, it is not as good as it could or should be.
Example: The condition of the sidewalk is very poor.

Definition: Presence is when someone or something is present in a particular place.
Example: The researcher discovered the presence of bacteria in the water sample.

Definition: To subject is to cause or force someone or something to experience something harmful or unpleasant.
Example: The location of the trees will subject them to strong winds from the hurricane.

Definition: A surge is a sudden, large increase in something.
Example: All at once, there was a surge of runners at the finish line.

Definition: A survey is a set of questions that are asked to a large number of people in order to find out about opinions.
Example: I filled out a survey about my shopping experience at the department store.

Definition: To target is to aim an attack at someone or something.
Example: Scientists are looking for new drugs to target cancer cells.

Definition: A trend is a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing.
Example: Lucy likes to think she started this fashion trend.

Definition: To validate is to make someone feel that his or her ideas and feelings are respected.
Example: Winning first prize will validate all of Tony’s hard work.

Definition: Carbon is a chemical element.
Example: Carbon is found in coal.

Definition: Carbon dioxide is a gas made from one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms.
Example: There is carbon dioxide in the smoke from coal power plants.

Definition: Dust is very small, dry particles of earth or sand.
Example: Some people wear medical face masks to avoid breathing in fine dust and germs.

Definition: To emit is to send out gas, heat, light, sound, etc.
Example: This iron emits steam.

Definition: To enable is to make it possible for something to happen.
Example: Studying hard will enable the girl to get a good job.

Definition: To grind is to break something into small pieces or powder.
Example: We grind wheat to make flour.

Definition: To heal is to become healthy or well again.
Example: This ointment will help heal your wounds.

Definition: To integrate is to make something a part of another larger thing.
Example: More women are being integrated into the military.

Definition: When something is leading, it is the most advanced or best.
Example: Teresa is the leading expert on brain surgery for dogs.

Definition: Moreover is used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said.
Example: Marianne likes to walk to work to save money; moreover, it is good exercise.

Definition: To object is to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something.
Example: The students object to raising the tuition.

Definition: A pollutant is a substance that makes the air or water not safe for use.
Example: A pollutant in the water killed this fish.

Definition: Powder is a dry substance in the form of very small grains.
Example: Turmeric is a yellow powder used in cooking.

Definition: To prompt is to cause someone to do something.
Example: The tight deadline will prompt the employee to work very hard.

Definition: To reject is to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something.
Example: I’m afraid the teacher will reject my new idea.

Definition: A skeptic is a person who disagrees with particular claims that are generally thought to be true.
Example: Kevin is a skeptic because he never believes anyone or anything.

Definition: A substance is a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas.
Example: Arsenic is a poisonous substance.

Definition: If something changes substantially, it changes a lot.
Example: The price of the apartment went up substantially.

Definition: A ton is a unit for measuring weight equal to 2000 pounds or 907.2 kilograms.
Example: This dump truck can carry up to 25 tons.

Definition: Transport is the system or method of carrying passengers or goods from one place to another.
Example: Cargo ships are used for the transport of manufactured goods.

Definition: To align is to support a political group, country, or person that you agree with.
Example: The crowd seemed to align themselves with the protestors.

Definition: An authority is someone who has the power to make decisions and enforce rules and laws.
Example: The local police department is the authority whenever large crowds gather.

Definition: A barn is a large farm building that houses crops, equipment, and animals.
Example: My grandparents keep hay in their red barn.

Definition: To betray is to be disloyal to someone who trusts you.
Example: The four friends would never betray each other’s trust.

Definition: The Bible is the book of sacred writing in the Christian religion.
Example: I read the Bible every night before I go to sleep.

Definition: A Catholic thing or person is one that is connected with the Roman Catholic Church.
Example: Rosanne is Catholic, so she goes to church every Sunday.

Definition: To cooperate is to work with someone to achieve something that you both want.
Example: The members of the team agreed to cooperate in order to get the project done.

Definition: To detain is to officially prevent someone from leaving a place.
Example: The police had to detain the thief for shoplifting.

Definition: An exit is something that is used as a way to get out of a place.
Example: The green sign shows where the exit is located.

Definition: An exceptional thing or person is one that is outstanding.
Example: Holly is an exceptional student.

Definition: To flee is to leave somewhere very quickly in order to escape from danger.
Example: When a predator approaches a deer, the deer will flee.

Definition: A network is a group of people or organizations that are in some way connected to each other.
Example: Lesley is part of a volunteer network that plants trees in the city.

Definition: To outrage is to make someone feel very angry or shocked.
Example: He was outraged when his proposal was turned down.

Definition: A parish is the area for which a priest in some Christian churches is responsible.
Example: Greg’s parish has grown over the past year.

Definition: A passage is a narrow space that people can move through.
Example: Follow the passage down the stairs.

Definition: A pastor is a minister in charge of a parish or church.
Example: The pastor speaks to the members of the church.

Definition: A patrol is a group of people or vehicles that go through an area to make sure that it is free of trouble or danger.
Example: The military patrol is responsible for keeping the area safe.

Definition: To raid is to attack a place in a short time in order to cause damage.

Definition: A rail is a system of tracks on which trains travel.

Definition: A microchip is a small device in a computer that holds information.
Example: I can put more data on my computer if I buy a more powerful microchip.

Definition: A phase is a stage in a process or the gradual development of something.
Example: The first phase in the recycling project involves finding volunteers to help out.

Definition: To pinch means to take a piece of skin between one’s fingers and squeeze.
Example: I pinched my nose so I couldn’t smell the odor from the garbage.

Definition: When something is prevalent, it is common.
Example: Growing a beard is more prevalent in some countries than in others.

Definition: When something is quantum, it relates to the behavior of atomic particles.
Example: The physics student studied quantum mechanics.

Definition: A ratio is a relationship between two things expressed in numbers or amounts.
Example: The boy-to-girl ratio is one to three.

Definition: A spiral is a shape which winds round and round as if around a cylinder.
Example: A strand of DNA looks like two interlocking spirals.

Definition: When something is viral, it is a disease or infection that is caused by a virus.
Example: The girl was in bed for a week when she had a viral infection.

Definition: An acid is a chemical that can burn or dissolve other substances.
Example: In chemistry class, we mixed two acids together and watched the reaction.

Definition: An administration is the group of people who manage a company or organization.
Example: She hoped she could be promoted to a job in administration.

Definition: Administrative describes anything related to managing a company or organization.
Example: I work as an administrative assistant to the owner of the company.

Definition: Biotechnology is the use of living parts, such as cells, in industry and technology.
Example: Researchers at the biotechnology company use bacteria to make medicine.

Definition: Cholesterol is a substance in fat, tissues, and blood of all animals.
Example: When people have too much cholesterol, they are at a high risk for heart problems.

Definition: A coalition is a group of people or organizations working for a common purpose.
Example: The companies formed a coalition to make trade less expensive.

Definition: When something is deceptive, it encourages one to believe something that is false.
Example: The scary-looking man’s appearance is deceptive; he is actually very nice.

Definition: Diabetes is a medical condition in which a person’s body cannot control the level of sugar in their blood.
Example: Overweight people are more likely to suffer from diabetes than slimmer ones.

Definition: To eliminate something that is unwanted means to completely remove it.
Example: Wearing a seatbelt eliminates some of the dangers of driving a car.

Definition: Erosion is the destruction of rock or soil due to flowing water or weather.
Example: Canyons are formed because rivers of fast-moving water caused erosion.

Definition: Ethics are moral beliefs or rules about right or wrong.
Example: The act of stealing certainly doesn’t go against some people’s ethics.

Definition: If something is explicit, it is very clear, open, and truthful.
Example: The man gave a very explicit account of the car accident.

Definition: A framework is a set of rules or ideas that people use to solve problems.
Example: His ideas fit into the framework of a successful business plan.

Definition: To manufacture something means to make it in a factory.
Example: My father’s company manufactures steel building materials.

Definition: A mechanism is a part of a machine that performs a certain function.
Example: I can’t open my car door because the locking mechanism is broke.

Definition: To minimize means to reduce something to the lowest possible level.
Example: I checked my homework twice to minimize errors I might have made.

Definition: Nectar is a sweet liquid produced by flowers that bees and other insects collect.
Example: Bees use nectar to make their honey.

Definition: A notion is an idea or belief about something.
Example: I had a notion that this route would get us to the beach.

Definition: A regime is a system of government or management.
Example: He was a member of the old regime that had been overthrown in the election.

Definition: When something is straightforward, it is good because it is easy to understand.
Example: The teacher’s grading system was straightforward and fair.

Definition: If someone is bankrupt, then they are unable to pay their debts.
Example: The store had few customers and soon went bankrupt.

Definition: To conform to rules or laws is to obey them.
Example: The new student had to conform to the school’s dress code.

Definition: To employ someone means to give work to them.
Example: The bookstore employed two full-time clerks.

Definition: To expel someone means to force them to leave a place.
Example: Since he would not follow the rules, the principal had to expel the student.

Definition: An extension is a part added to something to give it more time or space.
Example: My parents decided to add an extension to our house for the new baby.

Definition: If something is forthcoming, then it is about to happen in the future.
Example: Some economists predicted that the forthcoming world economy would be severe.

Definition: To furnish means to put furniture in a house or room.
Example: Most homes are furnished with tables, chairs, and beds.

Definition: Hygiene is the conditions or methods needed for health and cleanliness.
Example: People who brush their teeth at least twice a day are practicing good hygiene.

Definition: If something is hygienic, then it is clean and unlikely to cause disease.
Example: My sister works very hard to keep her entire home as hygienic as possible.

Definition: A landlord is a man who rents property to a person.
Example: The landlord collected everyone’s rent money on the first day of every month.

Definition: To lease means to rent property, usually an apartment or land.
Example: When the family first leased the apartment, the rent was very low.

Definition: If something is mandatory, then it is required by law.
Example: It’s mandatory that everyone be at least 16 to drive a car in the US.

Definition: To mend something means to fix it when it is broken or damaged.
Example: Mother mended the rip in my pants with a piece of cloth.

Definition: A mortgage is a loan for property, especially a home or a business.
Example: When they bought their new home, the married couple had to sign a mortgage.

Definition: Personnel are employees in a business.
Example: When business increased, we had to hire more personnel.

Definition: Plumbing is the system of pipes used in a home to supply water.
Example: When the plumbing stopped working, no one was allowed to use the toilets.

Definition: A quote is what someone has said, including saying how much a piece of work will cost.
Example: His writing was full of quotes from Shakespeare.

Definition: A tenant is a person who rents property from a landlord.
Example: The new tenants moved into the house across the street.

Definition: A utility is a business that supplies services such as water or electricity.
Example: If you don’t pay the utilities, you may have your electricity turned off.

Definition: Whereby means by which or through which.
Example: The mayor had a new bridge built whereby the citizens could cross the river.

Definition: To adapt means to change in order to deal with a new situation.
Example: When he went to the new town, he had to adapt to all the weather changes.

Definition: Biological describes the process of life and living things.
Example: In science class, we learned about the biological process of bacterial growth.

Definition: When something is cellular, it relates to the cells of animals or plants.
Example: She used a microscope to see the activity at a cellular level.

Definition: When people are dynamic, they are lively and have creative ideas.
Example: The new, dynamic employee came up with a good way to juggle his workload.

Definition: A fantasy is a pleasant situation that people think about but is unlikely to happen.
Example: Becoming an astronaut is a fantasy shared by many children.

Definition: Heredity is the process of passing on features from parents to children.
Example: The boy’s face is similar to his father’s because of heredity.

Definition: When something is internal, it exists or happens inside a person, object, or place.
Example: We removed the outer case to reveal the computer’s internal wires.

Definition: When something is minimal, it is very small.
Example: My lazy husband does a minimal amount of work around the house.

Definition: A pioneer is a person who is the first to discover or be involved in something.
Example: He was a pioneer of computer programming.

Definition: To prescribe medicine means to tell someone to take it.
Example: When I was sick, the doctor prescribed me flu medicine for me to take.

Definition: When things are respective, they relate separately to each person just mentioned.
Example: The boxers were told to return to their respective corners.

Definition: When rules or systems are rigid, they are severe because they cannot be changed.
Example: Societies often have rigid rules about the way that people are supposed to act.

Definition: A sequence is a number of events or things that come one after another.
Example: The dominos fell in a sequence of one after another.

Definition: Things which are similar are almost the same.
Example: I have had a similar experience to the one you described.

Definition: To substitute something or someone means to have them take the place of another.
Example: When I ran out of juice, I had to substitute water to drink in the morning.

Definition: A surgeon is a doctor who is trained to do surgery.
Example: The surgeon operated on the old man’s heart.

Definition: Therapy is treatment for a particular physical or mental illness or condition.
Example: After she broke her legs, she used physical therapy to learn how to walk again.

Definition: To transfer something means to move it from one place to another.
Example: The family transferred the groceries from the shopping cart to the car.

Definition: A transition is a process where there is a change from one form to another.
Example: The weather gets colder during the transition from summer to autumn.

Definition: A transplant is an operation in which a damaged part of one’s body is replaced.
Example: The sick child needed a heart transplant to live.

Definition: Astrology is the study of the stars in the belief that they influence people’s lives.
Example: Jack, who studies astrology, believes that the stars can predict the future.

Definition: A couple is made of two things that go together.
Example: There were a couple of problems I had to solve.

Definition: To deviate is to move away from your proper course.
Example: Very few deviate much from the average.

Definition: To differentiate things or people is to show the difference between them.
Example: It was hard to differentiate between the identical twins.

Definition: To disrupt something or someone is to prevent them from working.
Example: The loud crash disrupted the class lecture.

Definition: An equation is a math operation to determine the value of something.
Example: I used the Pythagorean theorem to solve the equation.

Definition: To err means to make a mistake.
Example: The pilot erred in his estimate of the time it would take to make the trip.

Definition: When something is erroneous, it is incorrect or only partly correct.
Example: The child held the erroneous belief that time machines were real.

Definition: If people or things are frantic, they behave in a wild way because they are frightened.
Example: The cat became frantic when I tried to give it a bath.

Definition: When an action is inadvertent, it is done without realizing what you are doing.
Example: She made an inadvertent error when she knocked over the nail polish.

Definition: To improvise something is to do it with whatever is available or without planning.
Example: There was no meat for the pizza, so we improvised with what was in the fridge.

Definition: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.
Example: The device was able to tell the traveler his exact latitude.

Definition: A mariner is a sailor.
Example: The old mariner used his telescope to find the shore.

Definition: A multitude of things or people is a very large number of them.
Example: A multitude of people were waiting at the airport.

Definition: A nuisance is a person or thing that is annoying or causes a lot of problems.
Example: The teenager considered her noisy little brothers to be quite a nuisance.

Definition: The permanence of something is its ability to last forever.
Example: Poor results threaten the permanence of the new system.

Definition: To revolve around something is to keep it as the main feature or focus.
Example: My life revolves around sports.

Definition: To soothe means to calm someone who is angry or upset.
Example: The mother soothed her crying baby by rocking him in her arms.

Definition: If someone is stranded, they are prevented from leaving a place.
Example: When the plane left, my sister and I were stranded in China.

Definition: A technique is a way of doing something.
Example: There are a lot of teaching techniques that are well supported by research.

Definition: If something or someone is absurd, they are ridiculous.
Example: That group of people making animal noises sounds completely absurd.

Definition: The aristocracy is the highest class of people in certain societies.
Example: Most members of the aristocracy were very well fed.

Definition: An aristocrat is a person who is of the highest class in certain societies.
Example: The aristocrat did not need a job because his family was wealthy.

Definition: Attire is nice or special clothing.
Example: Everyone wore their best attire to the president’s daughter’s wedding.

Definition: A craze is a brief and popular activity or object.
Example: Wearing bright red socks was a craze when I was in high school.

Definition: When one thing denotes another, it stands as a sign or substitute for that thing.
Example: Quotation marks are used to denote speech.

Definition: To enlarge something means to make it bigger.
Example: The classrooms were enlarged over the summer to make room for more students.

Definition: An excess is an amount of something that is more than needed or wanted.
Example: Because it never got cold that winter, many stores had an excess of coats.

Definition: If something is feminine, then it has qualities that are commonly related to women.
Example: Many of the older people thought his long hair made him look too feminine.

Definition: A hierarchy is a system of things or people ranked one above the other.
Example: Everyone knows where they fit in the hierarchy.

Definition: A pad is a thick piece of soft material used to protect or clean things.
Example: Football players wear shoulder pads to keep them safe.

Definition: Your partner is someone who lives or works with you as an equal.
Example: Ladies and gentlemen, take your partners for the next dance.

Definition: If something is predominant, then it is the most important, common, or strongest.
Example: Before cars were invented, horses were the predominant method of travel.

Definition: Protocol is a system of rules and customs that guides how things are done.
Example: The introduction of the guests followed the normal protocol.

Definition: If someone or something is reputable, then they have a good reputation.
Example: The service from the less-than-reputable company made her angry.

Definition: To signify means to be a symbol of something.
Example: A red octagon is used to signify a place to stop.

Definition: A strap is a thin long piece of fabric used to fasten, carry, or hold something.
Example: She put the strap of her purse over her shoulder and walked out the door.

Definition: Your style is the way you do things.
Example: Her clothes were all in the latest style.

Definition: A tangle is something or many things twisted together.
Example: The laces of his shoes were in such a tangle that he could not untie them.

Definition: Vanity is excessive pride or love of one’s own appearance or things one has done.
Example: Her vanity won’t allow her to pass a mirror without looking at herself.

Definition: If something goes ashore, it goes from the water to the land.
Example: After a long day of fishing, Glen pulled his boat ashore, so it wouldn’t float away.

Definition: To contradict means to state the opposite of what someone else has said.
Example: Ken was always fighting with his little sister because she kept contradicting him.

Definition: A counterpart is something that is very similar to something else in what it does.
Example: Our manager will meet our rival company’s counterpart later today.

Definition: When something or someone is devoid of a thing, they are missing it.
Example: The movie was devoid of any violence, so it was a perfect movie for the family.

Definition: To diverge is to become different or to follow a different direction.
Example: The road diverged into two paths that led to our houses.

Definition: An embryo is a human or animal that is still growing inside its mother.
Example: Some doctors say that what a mother eats has a big effect on her embryo.

Definition: When something finally happens, it happens at the end of a series of events.
Example: We finally reached our destination.

Definition: A gazette is a newspaper.
Example: Alice wants to write for a gazette when she’s older.

Definition: If something is homogeneous, it is made up of things which are all the same.
Example: All of the houses on Victor’s block were boring and homogenous.

Definition: An individual is a single member of a group.
Example: Each individual is responsible for themselves.

Definition: A major event is a very important event.
Example: There had been a major shift in government policy.

Definition: To obstruct something means to get in its way.
Example: The car broke down on the road and obstructed traffic for hours.

Definition: To plunge means to move down into something very quickly.
Example: The water in the pool was very cold, but the boy plunged in anyway.

Definition: To prolong means to make something last for a longer time.
Example: Sandy walked slowly across the beach, trying to prolong her lunch break.

Definition: To publicize is to make something get a lot of attention.
Example: The company publicized the job positions in the newspaper.

Definition: A surplus is an extra amount of something.
Example: The store sold their surplus items on sale.

Definition: When something survives, it manages to continue to live in spite of difficult circumstances.
Example: She survived a heart attack.

Definition: To theorize means to develop ideas about something.
Example: They enjoyed theorizing about how things worked.

Definition: To verify means to find out if something is true.
Example: Julian called the movie theater to verify that the movie started at nine.

Definition: If something or someone is vigorous, they use a lot of energy.
Example: Henry uses vigorous exercise to keep himself in shape.

Definition: An altar is a table used in churches.
Example: The altar had many lit candles on it.

Definition: Arthritis is an illness causing pain and swelling in a person’s joints.
Example: Agatha couldn’t play the piano anymore because of her arthritis.

Definition: Botany is the study of plants.
Example: Gardens are the best places for botany.

Definition: If something or someone is credible, they can be believed or trusted.
Example: Dick gave a credible reason for being late and didn’t get in any trouble.

Definition: If someone is deceased, they are dead.
Example: We visited the graves of our deceased grandparents.

Definition: Deception is the act of lying or tricking someone.
Example: The magic looked very real, but it was only deception.

Definition: A document is a written text, usually not in the form of a book.
Example: Please scan this document so we have an electronic copy.

Definition: Dung is solid waste material produced by animals.
Example: There was cow dung all over the field.

Definition: Dusk is the time in the evening when it begins to get dark.
Example: After dusk, Hannah went to catch fireflies in the park.

Definition: To gratify someone means to please them.
Example: Bonnie was gratified after receiving her gift from her parents.

Definition: To hone something is to improve it and make it very good.
Example: Lisa honed her chess skills through hours and hours of practice.

Definition: When you interpret something, you find its meaning, often by changing it into a different language.
Example: It is difficult to interpret while someone is speaking.

Definition: Your motive is your reason for doing something.
Example: We can show he had a motive to commit the crime, but we cannot show he did it.

Definition: Pneumonia is a dangerous illness causing the lungs to fill with liquid.
Example: Elaine got pneumonia after playing outside in the rain without a coat.

Definition: When someone is psychic, they know what will happen or what people think.
Example: I think my grandmother has psychic abilities because she can predict anything.

Definition: If someone is psychotic, they have a very serious mental illness.
Example: The psychotic patient believed he saw things that weren’t real.

Definition: The scope of something is how many people or things it relates to.
Example: Modern history has a wide scope.

Definition: If something or someone is sinister, they are evil.
Example: Bad guys in most movies have sinister laughs.

Definition: Strife is disagreement or fighting between people or groups.
Example: There was a lot of strife between Jim and Lisa about what TV show to watch.

Definition: Text is language used in communicating messages.
Example: Spoken text has many features which are different from written text.

Definition: An artery is a tube that takes blood from the heart to the rest of the body.
Example: Eating healthily keeps your arteries clean so blood can flow with ease.

Definition: Deterioration is the act of becoming worse.
Example: The lack of care led to the deterioration of the house.

Definition: If things or people are elusive, they are hard to find.
Example: The elusive fish only came out at night.

Definition: When you ensure something, you make sure it happens.
Example: Saving now will ensure we have enough money for our retirement.

Definition: To induce something means to make it happen.
Example: Running without good shoes may induce leg pain.

Definition: If two things are inseparable, they can’t be separated.
Example: Denise and Diana have been inseparable since they first met.

Definition: If something is invalid, it is not correct.
Example: The way to winning debates is to avoid invalid arguments.

Definition: To magnify something means to make it look bigger than it really is.
Example: Astronomers use telescopes to magnify faraway stars.

Definition: The mainstream is what is considered normal and accepted by most people.
Example: Before punk rock music became part of the mainstream, only a few people liked it.

Definition: A microbe is a very small living thing that often makes people sick.
Example: The first step in curing a disease is finding the microbe that causes it.

Definition: A minor problem is a very small and unimportant problem.
Example: This is a minor problem.

Definition: If something is negligible, it is extremely small and not important.
Example: The amount she owed was negligible. It was less than ten cents.

Definition: Paralysis is the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body.
Example: His paralysis meant that he had to use a wheelchair to get around.

Definition: A pest is an animal or insect that hurts plants or food.
Example: Many farmers put up scarecrows to keep pests of their corn.

Definition: To prevail means to be accepted or very common.
Example: Unfortunately, injustice still prevails in the country’s court system.

Definition: When you are in pursuit of something, you are chasing it.
Example: The pursuit of happiness is a basic human right.

Definition: To rupture means to tear or burst open.
Example: Sarah put too much water into the balloon, and it ruptured.

Definition: If things or people are savage, they are very violent or cruel.
Example: Wild animals are very savage when defending their babies.

Definition: To stun someone means to make them unable to speak due to surprise or shock.
Example: Tim fell of the swing and was too stunned to cry.

Definition: If one is susceptible to something like a disease, they are easily harmed by it.
Example: Not eating enough vegetables makes you more susceptible to getting sick.

Definition: To advocate a plan or idea is to support or suggest it in public.
Example: The group advocated increased spending on education and schools.

Definition: Albeit means although. (It is made of three parts – al(though), be, it.
Example: She was happy, albeit briefly.

Definition: To authorize something means to give permission for it.
Example: The mayor authorized the construction of a new statue in the park.

Definition: A civilian is someone who is not in the military.
Example: It was Todd’s job to keep civilians from entering the army facility.

Definition: A commodity is something that can be bought or sold.
Example: Fran’s uncle made most of his money trading commodities.

Definition: When we communicate with others, we talk or write to them.
Example: He was unable to communicate his feelings clearly.

Definition: A conquest is an event by which one country takes over another country.
Example: After the conquest, the people of the small city had no freedom.

Definition: To disclose something means to tell it to someone else.
Example: John came home late, so he had to disclose his activities to his wife.

Definition: The dynamics of a situation are the way that parts of it affect each other.
Example: A good psychologist needs to know a lot about the dynamics of brain disorders.

Definition: To enroll in something is to put one’s name on a list as a member of a group.
Example: The students had to enroll in the class one semester in advance.

Definition: When someone is envious, they want something that another person has.
Example: They were envious of their neighbor’s front yard.

Definition: When something is festive, it is happy and related to a party or celebration.
Example: Dean’s favorite part of Christmas is the festive clothing that people wear.

Definition: When we indicate something, we show or point out our thoughts or plans.
Example: They indicated that things would be likely to improve soon.

Definition: Lentils are very small beans that people cook and eat.
Example: Danni made her special soup with lentils when her husband was sick.

Definition: To marshal a group means to assemble them in order.
Example: The students were marshaled outside and put into groups.

Definition: Morale is the amount of hope that people have during a difficult situation.
Example: To improve our family’s morale, mom suggested going on a picnic.

Definition: Your mood is the way you are feeling.
Example: My boss is in a really bad mood today.

Definition: A prophecy is a prediction about what will happen in the future.
Example: Some people believe that prophecies are actually true.

Definition: A senate is a part of the government in some countries.
Example: Everybody liked Caroline and chose her to speak for them in the senate.

Definition: Unrest is a state of anger about something among the people in a place.
Example: High taxes caused much of the unrest that led to the Revolutionary War.

Definition: To certify something means to confirm that its results are true.
Example: The photograph on her passport certified that she was indeed Jolene Sawyer.

Definition: The parts of a coherent plan fit well together.
Example: This was a coherent program for solving the flooding problem.

Definition: To collaborate means to work together on something.
Example: When they collaborated, they managed to finish their chores early.

Definition: To compile things means to collect a variety of them into a group.
Example: She compiled a list of people who she wanted to attend her birthday party.

Definition: To curb something means to prevent it from happening or increasing.
Example: She curbed her anger by listening to a relaxing song.

Definition: To diagnose someone means to identify the medical condition they have.
Example: Several of the children were diagnosed with the flu.

Definition: To enact something means to make it into a law.
Example: The council enacted a law that would only allow buses to drive downtown.

Definition: A federation is a group of states or businesses working for a common cause.
Example: The United Nations is a federation designed to prevent war, disease, and famine.

Definition: If something is gross, then it is disgusting.
Example: The food was so gross that the dog couldn’t eat it without feeling sick.

Definition: If something is humane, then it is good and kind.
Example: Helping build homes for poor people is very humane.

Definition: If someone is needy, they are very poor.
Example: After he lost his job, he became very needy.

Definition: The onset of something unpleasant is the beginning of it.
Example: At the onset of the battle, the enemy wasn’t prepared for such a large attack.

Definition: To pledge means to make a promise to do something.
Example: Her mother pledged that she would find her daughter’s lost kitten.

Definition: To prohibit something means to not allow it.
Example: She prohibited the students from speaking until their work was done.

Definition: To render something means to make it become something else.
Example: His report was rendered unimportant by the release of new information.

Definition: Smallpox is a disease that causes tiny bumps on the skin and high fevers.
Example: When she saw the tiny bumps, she thought her son might have smallpox.

Definition: To transform something is to change it in a very significant way.
Example: The education system has been completely transformed.

Definition: To transmit something means to pass it from one person or place to another.
Example: The radio tower transmits a signal to all the radios in a 20-kilometer radius.

Definition: To vow means to make a promise to do something.
Example: Before they are allowed to work, all senators must vow to never accept bribes.

Definition: Something that is widespread is spread widely across the world.
Example: It is a widespread belief that colds are caused by cold weather.

Definition: To adhere means to act in the way that a rule or agreement says is right.
Example: If the new employees wish to succeed, they must adhere to the boss’s rules.

Definition: To administer means to take responsibility for organizing something.
Example: The teacher’s assistant will administer the test.

Definition: When people are compassionate, they feel pity and sympathy for others.
Example: The compassionate nurse tried to make the sick man feel comfortable.

Definition: To contaminate something means to put dirty or harmful chemicals into it.
Example: The lake was contaminated when pollutants entered the water.

Definition: A deficiency is a lack of something, especially something that is needed.
Example: Your snack has a deficiency of any real nutrients.

Definition: When you put an emphasis on prevention, you give special attention to prevention.
Example: The government placed a strong emphasis on educational reform.

Definition: An epidemic is an outbreak of a disease that spreads quickly.
Example: It was difficult to stop the flu epidemic.

Definition: A hazard is something that could be dangerous to a person’s health or safety.
Example: Smoking cigarettes poses many health hazards.

Definition: When something is imperative, it is extremely important and must be done.
Example: It was imperative for him to find a job.

Definition: Intestines are tubes through which food passes after it leaves the stomach.
Example: Whatever you eat goes into your intestines.

Definition: To manifest means to make something visible or obvious.
Example: The joy of the holiday season manifested as bright smiles on the faces of the children.

Definition: When a place is overcrowded, it has too many people or things in it.
Example: The lobby was overcrowded with people.

Definition: A practitioner is a doctor.
Example: She made an appointment with the practitioner to treat her cough.

Definition: The provision of something is the act of giving it to people in need or want.
Example: That department is responsible for the provision of emergency supplies.

Definition: To replenish something means to make it full or complete again.
Example: We planted nearly one hundred seeds to replenish the garden after the fire.

Definition: When a car reverses, it goes backwards.
Example: We reversed out of the parking place and then drove away.

Definition: When something is sterile, it is completely clean and free from germs.
Example: The hospital room looked quite sterile.

Definition: To upgrade something means to improve it or make it more efficient.
Example: He upgraded to a real fancy car.

Definition: When something is viable, it is capable of doing what it is intended to do.
Example: Her method of solving the math problem seemed viable.

Definition: When something is voluntary, it is done by choice but is not required.
Example: Many people attended the voluntary boat safety class.

Definition: An airway is the passage by which air reaches a person’s lungs.
Example: Since he was sick, mucus would occasionally get stuck in his airway.

Definition: The Almighty is a name for a god in a religion.
Example: Before eating, they thanked the Almighty for their food.

Definition: An advent is the arrival or beginning of an important person, thing, or event.
Example: During the advent of radio, very few programs actually played music.

Definition: A cycle is a series of events that go in a circle from the end back to the beginning again.
Example: They were caught in a cycle of poverty, lack of education, and unemployment.

Definition: If something is definitive, then it is the most official.
Example: This library has the definitive collection of books on ancient Egypt.

Definition: To equate one thing with another is to compare them and consider them very similar.
Example: She equated the man’s messy appearance with a lack of responsibility.

Definition: To found something on an idea or principal is to base it on that idea.
Example: This is founded on the belief that all people are created equal.

Definition: An ideology is a system of belief.
Example: Within the teachers’ ideology, there was a belief in the value of parent participation.

Definition: To inhale means to take air or a smell into the lungs.
Example: The camper inhaled the cool and fresh mountain air and felt relaxed.

Definition: To invoke something is to mention it to support an argument or ask for help.
Example: Before going into battle, the soldier invoked the name of his god for protection.

Definition: If something is lunar, then it is related to the moon.
Example: During a lunar eclipse, Earth’s shadow darkens the moon’s surface.

Definition: A novelty is something that is new, original, or strange.
Example: Ice cream was a novelty for him since he rarely had any.

Definition: If something is outmoded, then it is no longer in fashion or use.
Example: Black and white television sets are outmoded.

Definition: To personalize something means to design it to meet a person’s unique needs.
Example: He personalized the woman’s exercises to give her a better workout.

Definition: If something is psychiatric, then it is related to mental illness or its treatment.
Example: The doctor said the patient might have a psychiatric problem.

Definition: Psychiatry is the study and treatment of mental illness.
Example: Studying psychiatry has taught me a lot about mental illness.

Definition: A reflex is an unconscious action in which a body part responds to an event.
Example: There was a reflex when the doctor hit his knee with a rubber hammer.

Definition: A seizure is a sudden condition in which the body loses control and shakes.
Example: Bright fashing lights can cause seizures in children.

Definition: A session is a meeting at a regular time in order to discuss and solve an issue.
Example: Every three months, the managers met in a session to discuss regional sales.

Definition: A utensil is a common tool or container.
Example: It seemed that a fork was the wrong utensil for trying to eat the soup.

Definition: To allocate something means to put it aside for a certain purpose or person.
Example: The government allocated $100 million to aid the disaster relief effort.

Definition: When food is appetizing, it looks and smells very good.
Example: The appetizing plate of cookies was gone in half an hour.

Definition: When you assign work, you give that work to particular people.
Example: I was assigned the job of making sure everyone had plenty to drink.

Definition: A cavity is a hole or space in something.
Example: There was a small cavity in the wall of the cave, where an animal lived.

Definition: If something moves clockwise, it moves in a circle in the same direction as a clock.
Example: Turn the screw clockwise to tighten it.

Definition: When circles or rings are concentric, they have the same center.
Example: The target was a series of concentric circles.

Definition: Courtesy is the excellence of manners or social conduct.
Example: Jenna always behaves with great courtesy when people visit her home.

Definition: When food is crisp, it is hard or has a hard surface in a way that is pleasant.
Example: My favorite snack is a bag of crisp, delicious potato chips.

Definition: Discord is disagreement or fighting.
Example: There was much discord between the experts on the talk show.

Definition: To generate something means to cause it to develop or begin.
Example: The mayor promised to generate new jobs and programs to help the poor.

Definition: An item is a single separate piece.
Example: There were some items of clothing found at the crime scene.

Definition: An interchange of ideas between people is a discussion of each person’s idea.
Example: There was an interchange of ideas between the groups.

Definition: When something is multicultural, it relates to many different cultures.
Example: Everyone was welcome to attend the multicultural celebration.

Definition: An omission is something that has been left out or not done.
Example: Mike was upset because of the omission of his name during the ceremony.

Definition: To oversee something means to make sure that it is being done properly.
Example: His job was to oversee the progress of the construction project.

Definition: To pierce something means to make a hole in it using a sharp object.
Example: The arrow pierced the target in the very center.

Definition: When you select something, you carefully choose it.
Example: They had to select textbooks for each class.

Definition: The structure involves the shape and organization of the parts of a building or group.
Example: There are big differences in family structure in different cultures.

Definition: Visual relates to seeing.
Example: The visual displays were very attractive.

Definition: When something is wavy, it is not straight but has a series of curves.
Example: The child drew wavy lines all over the piece of paper.

Definition: Conversion is the act of changing something into a different state or form.
Example: The city discussed the conversion of the parking lot into a skateboard park.

Definition: To cram things means to put them into a place that can barely contain them.
Example: He crammed all of his shirts into the top drawer of the dresser.

Definition: To defer means to arrange for an action to happen at a later time.
Example: The girl was very sleepy, so she chose to defer her bath until morning.

Definition: To export products means to sell them to other countries.
Example: The United States exports many cereals and grains.

Definition: Fumes are unhealthy smoke and gases that are made by fires or chemicals.
Example: The engine put unpleasant, black fumes into the air.

Definition: When something is habitual, it is a behavior that a person usually does or has.
Example: The man was a habitual liar who was incapable of being honest with anyone.

Definition: To justify something means to show or prove that it is necessary.
Example: The government tried to justify its decision to bring the country into a war.

Definition: We use notwithstanding when we want to show that, although something has been done, it is not enough. A similar term is “in spite of”.
Example: Notwithstanding your objections, we have decided to move forward with the project.

Definition: Output is the amount of something that a person or thing produces.
Example: The boss hired more workers to increase the factory’s output of products.

Definition: Overpopulation is the state of having too many people in an area.
Example: The organization is concerned with the overpopulation of the world.

Definition: A patent is a right to be the only person allowed to make or sell a new product.
Example: He quickly established a patent for his brilliant invention.

Definition: To penalize someone means to punish him or her.
Example: The team was penalized when they broke the rules.

Definition: Petroleum is a liquid natural resource from which many fuels are made.
Example: The petroleum at that factory is used to make gasoline.

Definition: A region is a large area of land usually based on some common feature.
Example: This is the wheat-growing region of the country.

Definition: A scrap of something is a small amount of it.
Example: Chris liked to use many scraps of paper when thinking up ideas.

Definition: A sector is a part of a country’s economy in a specific type of industry.
Example: We learned about just a few of the factories within the manufacturing sector.

Definition: To subscribe to something is to agree with it.
Example: She subscribed to the view that musical education should be kept in schools.

Definition: To subsist means to have the food, water, and money needed to stay alive.
Example: Some people are forced to subsist on only a few dollars a month.

Definition: To suspend something means to delay or stop it from happening for a while.
Example: The oil company suspended production until it was sure the factory was safe.

Definition: A synthesis is a combination of different ideas or styles.
Example: The band’s music was a synthesis of many different musical genres.

Definition: An acrobat is a person who entertains people by doing amazing physical things.
Example: There were acrobats at the circus that did impressive and complicated jumps.

Definition: Advocacy is the act of supporting or recommending something.
Example: Janine’s strong advocacy for the event made people want to attend.

Definition: If something is communal, it involves a group of people.
Example: On the weekends, Theo and his son picked up trash in the communal park.

Definition: If something is fluid, it is smooth and moves gracefully.
Example: Boris was a famous ballet dancer because people admired his fluid movements.

Definition: To harmonize means to make different things go well together.
Example: The sweet and sour flavors of the dish harmonized well and tasted great.

Definition: If someone is industrious, they work hard.
Example: Dennis was very industrious, so he never had problems finding a job.

Definition: When someone is inventive, they are good at creating new things.
Example: The inventive student built a robot to help her with her chores.

Definition: Mandarin is one of the two main Chinese languages.
Example: Although John’s parents both spoke Mandarin, he could only speak English.

Definition: If something is metropolitan, it relates to a large city.
Example: After years of living on a farm, Rufu was finally moving to a metropolitan area.

Definition: To mimic something means to copy the way it sounds, moves, looks, etc.
Example: The hunter mimicked a duck’s call and shot the two ducks that called back.

Definition: When something is misguided, it is based on bad judgment or wrong beliefs.
Example: The snake bit Molly during her misguided attempt to catch it.

Definition: To rehearse means to practice and prepare for a performance in front of people.
Example: Vick’s band rehearsed all week before their first show.

Definition: A resourceful person is clever at using what resources they have.
Example: Because he was very resourceful, he could make most of the things he needed rather than buying them.

Definition: To scorn someone means to behave without respect toward them.
Example: The criminal was scorned by everyone in the community.

Definition: If something is sensory, it is related to the senses.
Example: Iris and Eric preferred the sensory thrill of watching movies in the theater.

Definition: A statute is a law that is official and has been written down.
Example: The new statute made it illegal to walk dogs in the park.

Definition: Technical skill requires good control of technique.
Example: Her technical skill was perfect.

Definition: A veteran is someone who has a lot of experience doing something.
Example: Hank was the team veteran and had completed more races than anyone else.
