Definition: A villain is an evil person who breaks the law or hurts others.
Example: The villain made of with half of my family’s valuables.

Definition: A vine is a plant that has long, twisting stems and climbs upward.
Example: The branches of the trees were covered with vines.

Definition: An aroma is a scent or smell.
Example: I love the aroma of coffee in the morning.

Definition: A beverage is a drink.
Example: The waiter brought our beverages first. Then he brought our food.

Definition: A cluster of things is a small group of them placed close together.
Example: She held a large cluster of grapes in her hand.

Definition: To combine is to join together to make a single thing or group.
Example: Mina combined peanut butter and jelly to make a sandwich.

Definition: When a liquid is condensed, it is made thicker.
Example: One way to make a dessert thick and sweet is to use condensed milk.

Definition: When something is contemporary, it is related to the present time.
Example: Contemporary scientists have learned quite a bit about DNA.

Definition: To cultivate plants is to care for them and help them grow.
Example: A research company is cultivating new kinds of rice to aid poor countries.

Definition: When something is divine, it is related to gods.
Example: Legends say that music was given to humans as a divine gift from the gods.

Definition: When it is humid, there is a lot of water in the air.
Example: It is very humid inside a sauna.

Definition: An odor is a very distinct smell.
Example: He knew there was a leak when he noticed the strong odor of natural gas.

Definition: The palate is the top part of the mouth.
Example: You can touch your palate with your tongue.

Definition: Paradise is the place or condition of happiness where things are perfect.
Example: My vacation in Hawaii was like being in paradise.

Definition: A plantation is a big farm that only grows certain kinds of crops.
Example: In the 1800s, there were many cotton plantations in the southern US.

Definition: When something is rapid, it moves or changes very quickly.
Example: His mother was surprised by her son’s rapid growth.

Definition: A rate is the speed at which something happens.
Example: Grass tends to grow at a very slow rate.

Definition: When something is soothing, it makes you calm or relaxed.
Example: The soothing music helped the baby fall asleep.

Definition: When something is subtle, it is not easy to see or notice.
Example: The handsome man has a subtle smile.

Definition: The texture of something is the way its surface looks and feels.
Example: The texture of a rock found in the water is typically very smooth.

Definition: When something is toxic, it is poisonous and very dangerous.
Example: Please check the label to see if the product is toxic.

Definition: To vary means to be different from another thing in size or amount.
Example: The heights of the people in my class vary by a large amount.

Definition: An admiral is someone who controls many military ships.
Example: They won the sea battle because of the admiral’s great leadership.

Definition: An arc is a curved shape.
Example: A rainbow is an arc of colored bands across the sky.

Definition: Your character is your personality.
Example: My sister’s character is fun and very outgoing.

Definition: Your conscience is your inner sense of what is right and wrong.
Example: I recycle everything I can, so my conscience is clear!

Definition: If you escape from a place, you succeed in getting away from it.
Example: She tried to escape from the building.

Definition: If something is fiery, it is burning strongly.
Example: The fiery blaze burned all night long.

Definition: Flesh is the muscle and fat on your body.
Example: The zebra’s flesh is covered by black and white skin.

Definition: A grapefruit is a fruit similar to an orange, but bigger and not as sweet.
Example: Would you like a grapefruit with your breakfast?

Definition: Hay is dry grass used to feed animals and can be used for different purposes.
Example: I need to buy some more hay for the horse to eat.

Definition: If you are horrified, you are very shocked and feel upset.
Example: I was horrified when I read about the old lady who was attacked.

Definition: Kerosene is a type of oil used in some lamps and stoves.
Example: Many people in poor countries cook on kerosene stoves.

Definition: A loop is a line made into the shape of a circle.
Example: He made a loop with the rope and placed it over the post.

Definition: The middle is nearest the center and with an equal number of things on each side.
Example: I suddenly woke up in the middle of the night.

Definition: A paddle is a piece of wood or plastic that moves a boat across water.
Example: Put your paddle in the water and pull hard to make the boat move.

Definition: When something is sour, it has a sharp and unpleasant taste.
Example: I don’t like lemons because I think they are too sour.

Definition: A stake is a small, sharp piece of wood or metal that is put into the ground.
Example: We marked our property by placing stakes into the ground.

Definition: A steward is a person like a waiter who serves food on planes and ships.
Example: The steward is bringing some tea.

Definition: String is a thin piece of fabric or rope.
Example: I found a large ball of string.

Definition: A thorn is a sharp part of a plant.
Example: Be careful of the thorns when you pick up the roses!

Definition: To wreck something means to destroy or ruin it.
Example: The teenagers wrecked the house for no reason at all.

Definition: To admonish someone is to tell them you disapprove of their behavior.
Example: The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.

Definition: If something is audible, then it is able to be heard.
Example: The sound of the drums was audible from miles away.

Definition: If things or people are awesome, they are impressive or frightening.
Example: The huge military plane was an awesome sight.

Definition: To beware means to be careful of something or someone that is dangerous.
Example: You should beware of driving fast on wet roads.

Definition: To brag means to talk of one’s abilities or achievements in a proud way.
Example: He had strong muscles and bragged about them to the entire class.

Definition: If someone is conscious of something, then they are aware of it.
Example: The new student was conscious of the other students staring at her.

Definition: To disagree with someone means to have a different opinion from them.
Example: The lawyers disagreed about the best way to settle the case.

Definition: To echo means that a sound repeats itself because it bounced off an object.
Example: The child yelled over the canyon, and the sound echoed off the wall.

Definition: If something is eventual, it will happen at the end of a series of events.
Example: The constant training and planning led the team to an eventual victory.

Definition: A hint is information that suggests something will happen or is true.
Example: I quietly passed on a hint to my sister about the test.

Definition: An idiot is a person who is not smart or who has done something silly.
Example: Because he got lost in the forest, the man felt like an idiot.

Definition: If something is immense, it is very large.
Example: An immense amount of money was needed to buy such a large boat.

Definition: If something is indirect, then it is not the easiest or straightest way.
Example: He chose to take the most indirect route to the coast.

Definition: An option is a choice between two or more things.
Example: The children were given the option of three houses to pick from.

Definition: A pastime is an activity that you do often for fun.
Example: In the US, baseball is considered a national pastime.

Definition: If something is perfect, then it is without any mistakes.
Example: She got all the questions right, so her score was perfect.

Definition: To pinpoint something means to locate it exactly.
Example: The navigation system in my car is able to pinpoint my exact location.

Definition: To switch means to change something to something else.
Example: Mom switched the TV station from the news to her favorite show.

Definition: If something is thorough, it is complete or done carefully.
Example: Tina did a thorough job of cleaning the stains out of the carpet.

Definition: To torment someone means to cause them to suffer on purpose.
Example: She tormented her little brother by taking his favorite toy.

Definition: If something is abrupt, it is sudden or unexpected.
Example: When the dancer fell down on her back, the ballet came to an abrupt stop.

Definition: Agony is severe pain or suffering.
Example: The boy yelled in agony when the puppy bit him.

Definition: An assassin is someone who murders an important person.
Example: An assassin killed Martin Luther King on April 4, 1968.

Definition: A beard is hair that grows on a man’s chin and cheeks.
Example: The farmer had a long beard, as white as snow.

Definition: A beast is a large and dangerous animal.
Example: Tanzania is home to many famous beasts, such as lions, leopards, and hyenas.

Definition: A chapel is a building where people go to pray and worship God.
Example: We were married in a small wedding chapel in Las Vegas.

Definition: A commentator is a person who gives opinions or describes something, often on TV or the radio.
Example: According to many commentators, this winter has been one of the coldest in the last century.

Definition: To con someone is to trick that person into doing something or giving up money.
Example: It was unfair of the fortune teller to con me out of 500 dollars.

Definition: A consensus is a general agreement among a group of people.
Example: The consensus among the children was that ghosts exist.

Definition: A conspiracy is a secret plan that two or more people make together to do something harmful or illegal.
Example: The businessman thought there was a conspiracy among his coworkers to get him fired.

Definition: A coup is an uprising in which people try to overthrow the government.
Example: At the end of the 18th century, Napoleon Bonaparte staged a coup to overthrow a group that had control of France.

Definition: To be cynical is to be unwilling to believe that people have good intentions.
Example: The man became cynical after being lied to many times.

Definition: A dome is a curved roof of a building.
Example: I looked up at the dome to admire its beauty.

Definition: To exclaim something is to say it loudly, suddenly, and excitedly.
Example: The singer interrupted the applause to exclaim his thanks after his performance.

Definition: A forum is an open public place in which meetings are held.
Example: The scientist shared her research at a special forum in the city.

Definition: Glamour is a quality relating to riches, wealth, and beauty.
Example: The young woman showed of her glamour during the photo shoot.

Definition: To harass someone is to bother or attack them repeatedly.
Example: The young girl would often harass her baby brother.

Definition: If you illuminate something, you shine light on or brighten it.
Example: In order to illuminate the stage, the crew turned on the spotlight.

Definition: To infame something is to provoke or intensify it.
Example: The tax increase will infame the public’s frustration with the government.

Definition: A melody is a series of musical notes that form the main part of a song.
Example: I had the melody of the song stuck in my head all day.

Definition: If you do something awhile, you do it for a short time.
Example: Wait here awhile, and I’ll bring some tea.

Definition: Cyberspace is the imaginary place on the Internet where activities occur.
Example: I didn’t receive your email. It probably got lost in cyberspace.

Definition: To edit means to correct a piece of writing so that it is suitable to be published.
Example: She asked her brother to edit her paper before she submitted it to her teacher.

Definition: An essay is a short piece of writing on a certain subject.
Example: She had to write a two-page essay for her English class.

Definition: To evaluate something means to study it, so a decision can be made.
Example: Jo and Ken evaluated the plan and agreed that it would work.

Definition: To faint means to go unconscious and fall down.
Example: Carol fainted because she hadn’t eaten in over a day.

Definition: If something is global, it happens all around the world.
Example: Pollution is a global problem.

Definition: A gymnasium is a building with equipment that you can use to get exercise.
Example: When I go to the gymnasium, I use the treadmill for twenty minutes.

Definition: To highlight something means to mark it with a color so that it is easy to see.
Example: I read my vocabulary list and highlighted the most difficult words.

Definition: If someone is ignorant about something, they have no knowledge about it.
Example: I’m a bit ignorant about his theories. Can you explain them to me?

Definition: An index is a list of words at the end of a book that gives information.
Example: If you look in the index, you’ll find the right page number.

Definition: A lecture is a long, educational speech.
Example: His lecture on world hunger was very informative.

Definition: A moral is a message at the end of a story that teaches you something.
Example: At the end of the story, the mother explained the moral to her children.

Definition: To operate means to work or function.
Example: I’m sorry, but the trains are not operating today.

Definition: If something is private, it is only used by one person or group.
Example: Don’t look at my diary! It’s private!

Definition: When something is recent, it happened a short time ago.
Example: I did not know what had caused his recent behavior.

Definition: A resolution is a personal decision.
Example: At New Year, I made a list of resolutions to help me have a better year.

Definition: A semester is a portion of a school year.
Example: Jack is in his second semester of college.

Definition: If something is typewritten, it is written on a computer or typewriter.
Example: This is an important, formal project and must be typewritten.

Definition: When something is weird, it is very strange.
Example: My best friend’s dad is a bit weird.

Definition: To accustom oneself to something is to get used to it.
Example: I find it difficult to accustom myself to new time zones when I travel around the world.

Definition: The alpha member of a group is the most dominant or has the highest rank.
Example: The largest lion was the alpha male of the pack.

Definition: To arouse means to awaken interest or attention in someone.
Example: The politician’s words were meant to arouse the protestors’ anger.

Definition: If someone is articulate, he or she has the ability to express ideas clearly and effectively.
Example: Alfred’s friends loved talking to him because he was so articulate and intelligent.

Definition: To buzz means to show excitement about something.
Example: Seoul buzzes from dawn till dusk.

Definition: To clash means to fight or argue over something.
Example: The sisters often clash over the right way to do things.

Definition: Classification means putting things into categories or groups that have things in common.
Example: According to scientific classification, a duck-billed platypus is an egg-laying mammal.

Definition: To cling to something means to hold onto it tightly.
Example: A mother sloth will cling tightly to her baby in the treetops.

Definition: Compliance is the act of following a rule or doing what you are supposed to do.
Example: The bratty child never shows compliance with her mother’s rules.

Definition: To comprehend something means to understand it.
Example: The player could not comprehend why he lost the game.

Definition: To congregate means to gather in one place.
Example: Seeing a group of birds congregate in the sky is an awesome sight.

Definition: Custody is the right to take care of someone or something.
Example: The prisoners were put in the custody of the jailers.

Definition: To disperse means to scatter everywhere.
Example: I watched the people disperse in all directions to avoid the charging bull.

Definition: To embody means to symbolize or represent something.
Example: Mother Teresa was said to embody goodness and kindness.

Definition: Empirical means involving scientific proof and evidence.
Example: Scientists must always find empirical evidence in their work.

Definition: Exclusion is the act of keeping someone out of a group.
Example: People gathered together to protest the exclusion of immigrants from our country.

Definition: To flock means to gather in one place.
Example: Groups of birds will flock to the river in the spring.

Definition: When animals graze, they feed on plants.
Example: The sheep and goats like to graze on the grass outside the village.

Definition: If someone is intelligent, they are very smart.
Example: The intelligent student graduated from high school with the highest marks in his class.

Definition: A jungle is a type of forest in a warm, rainy tropical area, where trees and plants grow very close together.
Example: Many kinds of animals, including birds, reptiles, and even elephants live in a jungle.

Definition: An account with a bank is an arrangement to keep one’s money there.
Example: After I paid for the new car, my bank account was nearly empty.

Definition: An architect is a person who designs buildings.
Example: The plans for building the new home were drawn by a famous architect.

Definition: To conceal something means to hide it.
Example: You should conceal your money so no one can take it from you.

Definition: If someone commits a crime, he or she does something bad that can be punished by law.
Example: Police quickly arrived at the scene of the crime.

Definition: A deed is a certificate that proves that someone owns something.
Example: When she bought the car, she was given a deed to show the car was hers.

Definition: Gratitude is a feeling of being thankful.
Example: The kids showed Aunt Tess much gratitude for visiting them.

Definition: A habitat is the natural home of animals or plants.
Example: Frogs are often found in a wet habitat, such as near a lake, river, or pond.

Definition: To intervene means to help stop a problem between two people or groups.
Example: The students argued until the teacher intervened.

Definition: A landmark is an object that helps people find or remember a location.
Example: The tall tree was used as a landmark for people to find the road to the inn.

Definition: If something is legal, it is related to the law or allowed by the law.
Example: It was not legal for him to drive until he was 18 years old.

Definition: If something is memorable, then it is remembered for a special reason.
Example: The party was memorable; people were still talking about it years later.

Definition: To oblige someone means to require them to do something.
Example: If I wanted to have playtime, I was obliged to clean my room once a week.

Definition: An offense is an action that breaks the law and requires punishment.
Example: He was put in jail for two days for the offense.

Definition: To proclaim something means to say it in public.
Example: The army general proclaimed that the war was won.

Definition: A rally is a large public meeting in order to support something.
Example: The school had a rally in the gym to support the basketball team.

Definition: To resolve something means to find a solution.
Example: She resolved the problem with her children by giving them both a toy.

Definition: Resources are a person’s or country’s money and materials that they can use.
Example: The poor man didn’t have the resources to feed himself.

Definition: A sentence is punishment given to someone who didn’t follow the law.
Example: The sentence for stealing a car is much worse than for stealing candy.

Definition: To volunteer means to offer to do something for free.
Example: Many people volunteered to help the adults learn to read.

Definition: A witness is someone who sees or hears a crime or accident happen.
Example: The woman was the only witness of the horrible crime.

Definition: Access is the right to enter or use something.
Example: The manager was the only person with access to the password.

Definition: Conduct is the way that someone acts.
Example: She was punished for her bad conduct.

Definition: When an event or action is constant, it happens a lot or all of the time.
Example: The television at home is in constant use.

Definition: A crack is a narrow space between the parts of something broken.
Example: The old window was covered with cracks.

Definition: A device is an object or a machine.
Example: A thermometer is a device that tells temperature.

Definition: To enclose something is to contain it.
Example: The cows in the field were enclosed by a fence.

Definition: To grip something is to hold it very tightly.
Example: I was scared, so I gripped my older sister’s hand.

Definition: To halt is to stop moving.
Example: The criminal halted when he saw the police coming.

Definition: If something is impending, it is going to happen soon.
Example: The student was nervous about her impending test.

Definition: To influence someone or something is to have an effect on them.
Example: My friend influenced my decision to attend Terrance University.

Definition: A law is a rule made by the legislative body.
Example: The students learned about different laws during social studies class.

Definition: A mode is a setting or condition on a machine.
Example: Melissa turned the TV to quiet mode while she talked on the phone.

Definition: To perspire means to sweat.
Example: I usually perspire a lot when I am at athletics practice.

Definition: To replace something is to put it in the place of something else.
Example: I replaced the tire on my car because it was flat.

Definition: To snap something means to break it suddenly, which can cause a loud noise.
Example: I took the drumstick and snapped it with my hands.

Definition: If a person or animal is sly, they are sneaky or good at tricking people.
Example: The sly fox stole the eggs from the nest.

Definition: To tend to do something is to be likely to do it or to do it often.
Example: My mom tends to buy me the perfect gift each Christmas.

Definition: When something is valid, it is correct or based on good reasoning.
Example: The expert’s opinion on the subject was more valid than others.

Definition: A version is an account of something that differs slightly from the original.
Example: She read the students British version of the Chinese fairy tale.

Definition: You use whatsoever after a noun to emphasize that there is nothing of that thing.
Example: The boy had no idea whatsoever how to finish the story.

Definition: If something is alongside another thing, then it is next to it.
Example: We work alongside each other in the office.

Definition: Your appetite is your hunger for food.
Example: Tom has a big appetite. He eats all the time.

Definition: To assist someone is to help them.
Example: Andrew assisted me with my homework.

Definition: A breeze is a soft wind.
Example: The breeze caused the leaves to fall off the tree.

Definition: To defy someone is to work against them or refuse to do what they say.
Example: The students got into trouble for defying their teacher’s rules.

Definition: To display something is to show it, especially by putting it in a certain place.
Example: The museum displayed many wonderful paintings.

Definition: If something or someone is efficient, they do not waste energy.
Example: My car is very efficient. I rarely have to buy gas.

Definition: If someone is feeble, they are small or weak.
Example: The boy was too feeble to carry the object very far.

Definition: To forgive someone is to stop being angry with them.
Example: Sandra forgave Peter after he said he was sorry.

Definition: If someone is lively, they have a lot of energy.
Example: Jennifer is very lively: she’s always running and playing.

Definition: If something is majestic, it is large and impressive.
Example: The rich people lived in a big, majestic house.

Definition: You use nor to connect two negative ideas.
Example: I eat neither apples nor oranges. I don’t like either one.

Definition: If someone is outraged, they are very angry.
Example: My father was outraged when he saw that I had crashed his car.

Definition: If someone is pessimistic, they believe that the worst will happen.
Example: John is pessimistic. He always thinks something bad will happen.

Definition: The relationship between two or more people is the way in which they behave toward each other.
Example: The teacher was proud of her good relationship with the students.

Definition: To slap someone means to hit them with the palm of the hand.
Example: Out of anger, Helen slapped Eunice on the face.

Definition: To smash something is to break it into many small pieces.
Example: Jacob smashed the window with a rock.

Definition: Someone who is successful achieves what they intended to achieve.
Example: My father is a successful businessman.

Definition: A wage is the money that a person gets for doing a job.
Example: The wages I receive from my job are really great!

Definition: You use whereas to show how two things are different.
Example: My sister loves horror movies, whereas I prefer comedies.

Definition: When something is animate, it has life.
Example: Rocks and machines are not animate things.

Definition: To classify things is to put them into groups based on their type.
Example: The biologist classified the plant as a completely new species.

Definition: To concede is to admit against your wish that something is true.
Example: The student conceded that he had cheated on the test.

Definition: A concept is an idea about something.
Example: I learned some concepts about molecules before working in the science lab.

Definition: To construct something means to make or build it.
Example: The men used wood and metal to construct a house.

Definition: A decade is a period of ten years.
Example: She celebrated her three decades of work with the company.

Definition: A diagram is a simple drawing that explains what something is or how it works.
Example: By following the diagram, I was able to put the desk together.

Definition: A ferry is a boat that carries passengers over short distances.
Example: The ferry took the people across the lake.

Definition: If something is handy, it is useful.
Example: An eraser is handy if you make a lot of mistakes.

Definition: To isolate is to separate one person or thing from a group.
Example: The teacher isolated the bad child from the class before talking with her.

Definition: A longing is a strong feeling of wanting.
Example: Since he skipped breakfast, he had a longing for food all morning.

Definition: If something is numerous, there are many of those things.
Example: It was hard to drive fast since there were numerous holes in the road.

Definition: A particle is a very small piece of something.
Example: The bottles of wine were covered in a layer of dust particles.

Definition: A plea is a request that is urgent or emotional.
Example: The poor, hungry man made a plea for food.

Definition: To refrain from something is to avoid doing it.
Example: The doctor asked Mary to refrain from eating fast food as part of her diet.

Definition: A review of something is a formal inspection of it by people in authority.
Example: The government ordered a careful review of the economic situation.

Definition: If someone is sophisticated, they know many things about the world.
Example: Jake is one of the most sophisticated people I’ve ever met.

Definition: To surrender something is to give it up.
Example: The thief surrendered the money to the police when he was caught.

Definition: If something is upright, it is standing up straight.
Example: Meerkats can’t walk like humans, but they can stand upright.

Definition: If something is worthwhile, it is important or useful.
Example: On his visit to Canada, he realized studying English was worthwhile.

Definition: An alliance is a group of people who work together.
Example: The junior executives formed an alliance with each other.

Definition: Applause is the noise made when people clap their hands to show approval.
Example: At the end of his speech, everyone burst into loud applause.

Definition: If you are armed, you are carrying a weapon.
Example: The robber was armed with a gun.

Definition: If something is authoritative, it uses the best information available.
Example: This book is an authoritative source on ancient Egypt’s Queen Nefertiti.

Definition: Bravery is brave behavior.
Example: The books commended the general’s bravery.

Definition: A ceremony is an event that happens on special occasions.
Example: Tom and Amy’s marriage ceremony is in June.

Definition: Culture is the music, art, and writings of a certain place or group of people.
Example: Ancient Mexican culture is renowned for its architecture.

Definition: A defense is something that is done to protect another thing.
Example: The air force works in defense of its country.

Definition: A detail is a small piece of information.
Example: Jane told Ben all the details of her trip to China.

Definition: When a group of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things.
Example: Big cities have diverse populations with people of different races and ages.

Definition: To enchant someone is to make them feel very interested or happy.
Example: The beautiful woman enchanted everybody in the room.

Definition: To equip someone is to give them the things needed to do something.
Example: Steve was equipped with the tools needed to do the job.

Definition: An exception is someone or something not conforming to a rule.
Example: Most students thought the test was hard, but Tim was the exception.

Definition: A genre is a type of literature, art, or music characterized by its style.
Example: She is considered a master in the comedy genre.

Definition: An impact is the effect someone or something has.
Example: My grandmother had a great impact on my life.

Definition: To lure someone is to convince them to do something by using a trick.
Example: The store lures people in with big signs that say “Sale!”

Definition: An obstacle is an object or a problem that stops you from doing something.
Example: Climbing over the giant rock was the biggest obstacle for the hikers.

Definition: A shelter is a place to go that is safe from danger or bad weather.
Example: The frog took shelter from the storm in a nearby hold.

Definition: To supply something means to give people what they need or want.
Example: The water heater supplied the house with warm water.

Definition: If people are vain, they are only concerned with how they look.
Example: Rebecca is so vain that she looks at herself in every mirror.

Definition: An alternative is something that you can choose instead of your first choice.
Example: Her first plan to make extra money seemed weak, so she chose an alternative.

Definition: An avenue is a road, often a large one with buildings on each side.
Example: Drive down this avenue and then turn left to get to the park.

Definition: The belly is the stomach of a person or animal.
Example: His belly was full because he had eaten a lot of food.

Definition: A bid to do something is an attempt to do it.
Example: He made a bid to become the university’s next president.

Definition: To blow means to move air or move something through the air, as in the wind.
Example: The wind is blowing very hard today. We should stay inside.

Definition: A conflict is a fight between different people or groups.
Example: The two nations had a conflict over which one could use the water in the river.

Definition: A continent is one of the seven large areas of land on the Earth.
Example: Asia is the largest continent.

Definition: A current is a steady and constant flow of air or water in a river or ocean.
Example: The ocean currents took the ship far off into the sea.

Definition: Disrespect is rudeness or behavior that shows a lack of respect.
Example: He showed disrespect by arguing with his boss during a meeting.

Definition: Enthusiasm is a very strong good feeling about something.
Example: The crowd showed their enthusiasm for the soccer team by cheering loudly.

Definition: When something is harsh, it is very unpleasant.
Example: The desert can be a very harsh environment.

Definition: To lean is to bend in a particular direction.
Example: The woman leaned against the counter because she was tired.

Definition: The meantime is the time between two events.
Example: Ted began setting the table. In the meantime, I began preparing the food.

Definition: Mischief is behavior that is meant to trick or cause trouble for people.
Example: Ben was up to mischief when he persuaded Ken to paint his face.

Definition: Muscle is a mass of tissue attached to bone that helps you move.
Example: She went to the gym in order to make her muscles stronger.

Definition: To rescue someone means to remove them from danger.
Example: The firefighter rescued the man from the burning building.

Definition: A succession is a number of things that follow one after the other.
Example: The student said the letters of the alphabet in succession.

Definition: The terrain is the land and all of its physical features or parts.
Example: The terrain below was rocky and full of hills.

Definition: If someone is timid, they are afraid, shy, or nervous.
Example: The timid child hides behind her mother whenever she sees a stranger.

Definition: Violence is forceful action that is meant to injure or kill people.
Example: The boy hit his brother in an act of violence.

Definition: To affect someone or something is to have an influence over them.
Example: The student’s poor attitude affected the other students in the class.

Definition: An autograph is the written name of a famous person.
Example: Everybody wanted the movie star’s autograph.

Definition: A bead is a drop of liquid.
Example: Beads of water collected on the outside of the glass.

Definition: To brew coffee or tea means to pour hot water over it.
Example: Please brew a fresh pot of coffee.

Definition: To charm someone is to please them with your personality.
Example: Gail charmed everyone with her humorous stories.

Definition: A destiny is all the things that happen or will happen to a person in their life.
Example: It was his destiny to become a great singer.

Definition: Equipment consists of the things which are used for a specific purpose.
Example: The factory produces a wide range of high-tech equipment.

Definition: A horn is a device that makes a loud noise.
Example: The boy honked his horn as he rode his bicycle past the house.

Definition: When someone is irritable, they become annoyed or angry very easily.
Example: She is irritable when she doesn’t get enough sleep.

Definition: To lag behind is to move slowly behind other moving objects.
Example: The girl on rollerblades lagged behind the little girl on the bicycle.

Definition: A nightmare is a bad or scary dream.
Example: The girl was scared to go back to sleep because she had had a nightmare.

Definition: When something is nutritious, it helps the body stay healthy.
Example: Mangoes are one of the most nutritious fruits in the world.

Definition: Protein is a substance that is necessary for the body to grow and be strong.
Example: Fish and beef are good sources of protein.

Definition: A signature is your name, when you write it in your own way.
Example: I put my signature at the end of the letter.

Definition: Stuff is a word used to refer to things without mentioning the things by name.
Example: We gave a lot of stuff to the charity.

Definition: When something is subconscious, it is done without thinking about it.
Example: Breathing is one of the subconscious things that the body does.

Definition: A van is a vehicle that is used for carrying things. It is smaller than a truck.
Example: The delivery company uses large vans to deliver packages.

Definition: To warn someone is to make them know of possible danger in the future.
Example: The lifeguard warned people to stay away from the rough ocean.

Definition: A workout is an exercise routine that helps improve health.
Example: She doesn’t do her workout on the weekends.

Definition: To zoom is to move quickly.
Example: The cars zoomed along the road.

Definition: A brick is a block of hard clay that is used for building things, such as walls.
Example: There were several bricks scattered on the ground.

Definition: To crumble means to break or fall apart into small pieces.
Example: The old house’s walls crumbled into a pile of rock and wood.

Definition: Dough is a mixture of four and water that becomes bread when baked.
Example: I made heart-shaped cookies from the dough.

Definition: To express a feeling or idea means to show others how one thinks or feels.
Example: The nurse expressed her sympathy for the sick patient.

Definition: A fist is a hand with fingers bent in toward the palm.
Example: The bully made a fist and threatened to hit the small boy.

Definition: If something is flexible, then it can bend easily without breaking.
Example: The tree branch was so flexible it could be bent into a circle and not break.

Definition: To flush means the face becomes red due to heat, illness, or emotion.
Example: After the long race, the runner’s face was flushed.

Definition: To injure someone means to damage a part of their body.
Example: The car crash injured two people.

Definition: A lump is a small piece of something that is solid.
Example: The artist took a lump of clay and turned it into a beautiful pot.

Definition: A mixture is something that is made by mixing other things together.
Example: The walls were built using a mixture of water, rock, and dirt.

Definition: To reconcile means to return to a friendly relationship.
Example: After arguing, the two friends were reconciled with each other.

Definition: To ruin something means to harm or damage it greatly.
Example: Our walk in the park was ruined by the sudden rain.

Definition: To shatter something means to break it suddenly into many tiny pieces.
Example: When the ball hit the window, the glass shattered.

Definition: Shutters are wooden or metal covers in front of a window.
Example: Mr. Smith closed the shutters every night to make his bedroom dark.

Definition: To sift something means to remove all the large pieces.
Example: The baker sifted the flour into a large bowl.

Definition: If something is slight, then it is small or minor.
Example: There was only a slight change in the little boy’s height.

Definition: To sparkle means to shine brightly with quick fashes of light.
Example: The stars sparkled in the winter night’s sky.

Definition: To sprinkle means to scatter something all over something else.
Example: He sprinkled the pasta with salt and black pepper.

Definition: If food is stale, then it is not fresh but dry, hard, and not good to eat.
Example: The cookies sat on the table so long that they became stale.

Definition: To utter a word or a sound means to say it.
Example: The lost boy was so scared that he could barely utter a single word.

Definition: You use although to say that one thing is contrasted by another.
Example: Although she was late, her friends gave her a warm welcome.

Definition: To apply something means to put it on.
Example: She always applies makeup to her face before going outside.

Definition: To await something means to wait for it.
Example: The players awaited the referee’s decision.

Definition: When something is beloved, it is very special and you like it very much.
Example: The boy took a nap next to his beloved cat.

Definition: A climate is the usual weather in a place.
Example: The climate in the desert is very hot.

Definition: When you complain, you say that you are unhappy about something.
Example: The workers complained that they were being treated unfairly.

Definition: To confuse someone means to make them feel like they are unsure.
Example: The sign confused the traveler because it pointed in two directions.

Definition: When something is due, it is expected to happen or be done at that time.
Example: The papers were due on the 19th.

Definition: To establish something means to create it.
Example: He wanted to establish a club for people to help the Earth.

Definition: A furnace is a place where heat is made.
Example: Mr. Jones came to fix the furnace.

Definition: A leash is a rope or chain that is used to lead an animal.
Example: Dogs must wear a leash to keep them from running away.

Definition: To mature means to grow up to become an adult.
Example: When they matured, they became as tall as their parents.

Definition: To measure something means to find out the quality, value, or effect of it.
Example: The scientists carefully measured the amount of chemicals in the tubes.

Definition: The midst of something is the middle of it.
Example: She was in the midst of cleaning when the telephone rang.

Definition: Misery is extreme suffering.
Example: There was a lot of misery after Sam lost his dog.

Definition: Powerless means without power or authority.
Example: I fear my father is powerless now.

Definition: When something happened prior to something else, it happened earlier.
Example: Ron had to wait since he arrived prior to the scheduled meeting time.

Definition: Research is close and careful study to discover new things.
Example: Scientists did a lot of research on the subject of blood type.

Definition: A spaceship is a craft designed for spaceflight.
Example: Many people want to travel into space by spaceship.

Definition: A variety of something is a group of many different kinds of it.
Example: There are a variety of flowers at the shop.

Definition: If something happens altogether, it happens completely.
Example: The company stopped using sugar altogether in its food.

Definition: To bind people is to make them feel united together.
Example: The victims of the flood were bound by their need to help each other.

Definition: A bruise is a dark mark caused by being hit by something.
Example: She got a bruise on her knee from falling down.

Definition: A custom is a way of doing things that has been the same for a long time.
Example: It is a custom that the bride and groom have the first dance.

Definition: When someone is disobedient, they do not follow the rules or instructions.
Example: The disobedient children didn’t listen to their mother and had an accident.

Definition: To foresee something is to know about it before it happens.
Example: The teacher didn’t foresee any problems with his large class.

Definition: To glimpse something is to see it for a short time.
Example: She glimpsed outside the window as the plane was about to land.

Definition: A hoop is a ring that is made of plastic, metal, or wood.
Example: The boys tried to toss the ball through the basketball hoop.

Definition: Misfortune is bad luck or an unlucky event.
Example: His family helped him when he encountered misfortune.

Definition: When something is negative, it is unpleasant or sad.
Example: She doesn’t like to say negative things about her friends.

Definition: Per is used to mean “each” when giving a price, size, or amount.
Example: It costs eight dollars per person to watch the baseball game.

Definition: To plead is to ask for something you want very badly.
Example: He pleaded for his parents to let him go to the soccer game.

Definition: To rip something means to pull it apart.
Example: She ripped the paper in half by accident.

Definition: The sake of something is the reason for doing it.
Example: The parents worked hard for their children’s sake.

Definition: To scrape something is to rub it very hard with something sharp.
Example: I accidentally scraped the paint of the side of the car.

Definition: A source of something is the place that it comes from.
Example: The river was the source of drinking water for the village.

Definition: When somebody is stern, they are very serious.
Example: The stern teacher didn’t allow the students to speak during class.

Definition: To stitch is to use a needle and thread to join pieces of cloth together.
Example: My grandmother stitched the pieces together to make a big blanket.

Definition: A thump is the sound of a heavy object hitting something.
Example: They heard the thump when the bowling ball hit the floor.

Definition: When somebody is vehement, they are angry and emotional.
Example: Gina was vehement when she found out that Liz was bad in school.

Definition: If something is ailing, it is sickly or not doing well.
Example: Antonio’s ailing health caused his head to hurt.

Definition: If two people or things are alike, they are similar to each other.
Example: The brothers looked so much alike that it was impossible to tell one from the other.

Definition: To appall means to disgust someone.
Example: Minerva was appalled when she read the email from her enemy.

Definition: To bathe means to wash oneself with water.
Example: The mermaid bathed herself in the ocean.

Definition: Bounds is the area in a game in which plays are legal.
Example: If your ball lands outside the lines, it’s out of bounds.

Definition: To critique means express an opinion about the good and the bad parts of something.
Example: My job is to critique the food at various restaurants.

Definition: Demography is the study of people and populations.
Example: If you study demography, you’ll see huge population growth in some areas of the world.

Definition: A diagnosis is a doctor’s decision about the cause of an illness.
Example: The vet’s diagnosis was that our dog had a broken leg.

Definition: A dip is a decline or a worsening in condition.
Example: The economy experienced a dip in the 1930s, leading many workers to lose their jobs.

Definition: Distress is a feeling of sadness and anxiousness.
Example: We were in great distress when our home was destroyed during the last hurricane.

Definition: A fever is when a body’s temperature is higher than normal.
Example: He had to miss school because he was sick with a fever.

Definition: Something that is grim is worrying, serious, and scary.
Example: The boy made the grim discovery that he had accidentally deleted his homework.

Definition: Someone’s gut is their intestines, where food is processed after leaving the stomach.
Example: Thousands of bacteria live in your gut and help you digest food.

Definition: A helmet is a type of hard hat that protects your head.
Example: When exploring underground caves, it is important to always wear a helmet.

Definition: An herb is a plant used for cooking or medicine.
Example: I couldn’t decide which herb I wanted to buy at the market.

Definition: If someone is militant, they are angry and aggressive, and willing to fight easily.
Example: The woman delivered an angry, militant speech on the floor of the legislature.

Definition: A miracle is an unexpected blessing which seems almost impossible, like a gift from heaven.
Example: A miracle happened when Rosalita won over 60 million dollars in the lottery.

Definition: To mourn means to show or feel great sadness when you lose someone.
Example: The entire family mourned their grandfather’s death together.

Definition: Nonsense are words or ideas that are silly or foolish.
Example: The baby was talking nonsense into the phone.

Definition: A physician is a doctor.
Example: The physician was a friendly man who did his best with all of his patients.

Definition: An accent is a certain way of speaking that shows where a person is from.
Example: The new teacher’s accent was clearly a German one.

Definition: A barber is a person whose job is to cut men’s hair.
Example: My hair is getting much too long. I’d better go to the barber’s shop.

Definition: A basement of a house or building is a room that is built underground.
Example: They turned their basement into a game room.

Definition: When something is blank, it does not have anything on it.
Example: She got a blank piece of paper to draw on.

Definition: To blink means to shut the eyes and quickly open them again.
Example: I blinked many times so that my eyes could adjust to the bright light.

Definition: A choir is a group of people who sing together.
Example: He had choir practice every day after school.

Definition: When something is comic, it is funny.
Example: The comic actor was famous for his jokes.

Definition: To complicate something means to make it harder than necessary.
Example: The bad weather complicated finishing the job quickly.

Definition: To decline an offer or invitation means to say no to it.
Example: She declined his offer to pay for her dinner.

Definition: An errand is a trip taken to do a specific activity.
Example: He couldn’t go to practice because he had several errands to do.

Definition: A glove is a piece of clothing that covers your fingers and hand.
Example: When it gets cold, I always put on a pair of gloves.

Definition: A hermit is one who lives alone and does not spend time with others.
Example: The hermit lived a simple life in a small cave in the forest.

Definition: If something is done justly, then it is fair.
Example: We justly decided to give the prize to him.

Definition: Leather is a material made from animal skin that is used to make clothing.
Example: He got a new leather jacket for his birthday.

Definition: To ponder something is to think about it carefully.
Example: She sat in the park and pondered her problem.

Definition: To reserve something means to keep it for a certain person or time.
Example: He reserved a table at the busy restaurant.

Definition: A script is the words of a film or play.
Example: He read the script of the play three times.

Definition: To search for something or someone means to look for them carefully.
Example: I searched the newspaper for a new job.

Definition: To slam is to close something hard.
Example: She slammed the book shut after she finished reading it.

Definition: A staircase is a set of stairs found inside a building.
Example: The staircase leads directly into the kitchen.

Definition: Afflicted means to suffer physically or mentally.
Example: He was afflicted by pain in his right arm.

Definition: An aisle is a space between two things that people use to walk.
Example: They were told to clear the aisle because the plane was about to land.

Definition: The atmosphere is the air around the Earth where weather conditions form.
Example: Scientists worry that harmful substances are hurting the atmosphere.

Definition: An author is a person who wrote a certain piece of writing.
Example: The author was hard at work on his next novel.

Definition: A breakdown is a failure to work correctly.
Example: Her car had a breakdown, and she wasn’t sure how to fix it.

Definition: Cargo is the items carried by a ship or an airplane.
Example: The cargo of the ship got wet when it started raining.

Definition: A chapter is a part of a book that usually has a number or a title.
Example: The first chapter of a book usually introduces the main character of a story.

Definition: To connect two things means to join them together.
Example: I connected the mouse to my laptop computer.

Definition: Etc. is short for “etcetera.” It is used to refer to other unspecified objects.
Example: She was going to bring treats to the party: cookies, muffins, cake, etc.

Definition: To flip means to press a switch quickly to turn it on or off.
Example: To turn on the lights, just flip this switch.

Definition: If you are idle, you are not doing anything.
Example: She read a book to keep from being idle.

Definition: To notify someone of something is to tell them about it.
Example: The teacher notified us about a change to our assignment.

Definition: Peas are a vegetable that is small, round, and green.
Example: His favorite food was peas.

Definition: A raisin is a dried grape.
Example: Raisins are one of my favorite snacks.

Definition: To retain something is to keep it.
Example: Even by the afternoon, the day had retained the morning’s freshness.

Definition: To state something means to say it in a definite way.
Example: The president stated his opinion about the world’s health concerns.

Definition: A tray is a fat plate used to hold food.
Example: The waiter brought our food on a tray.

Definition: If something is unfortunate, it is bad or unlucky.
Example: It was unfortunate that Dave’s team lost, but he still had fun.

Definition: When something is vivid, it is bright and colorful.
Example: The figures in the painting were vivid.

Definition: To vomit means to have food come up from one’s stomach.
Example: It is common for women to vomit when they are pregnant.

Definition: Ambition is the desire to succeed and to become the best at something.
Example: His great ambition led him to try to climb the mountain alone.

Definition: An ambulance is a vehicle that transports people in a medical emergency.
Example: The ambulance sped through the street to get to the accident.

Definition: An ankle connects your leg to your foot.
Example: The man hurt his ankle while jogging in the park.

Definition: A cabin is a small wooden house in a forest or camping area.
Example: The man reached the mountain cabin after a long day of hiking along the river.

Definition: A calendar is a chart that shows the days, weeks, and months of a year.
Example: Marco used an online calendar to keep track of his schedule.

Definition: A calorie is a unit of heat used to measure how much energy a food will produce.
Example: My sister is on a low-calorie diet for fitness training.

Definition: A cave is an open space or hole underground or inside a mountain or cliff.
Example: A crystal blue lake could be found in the underground cave.

Definition: Constantly means doing something on a continuous basis.
Example: He was constantly checking his watch to see if he was late.

Definition: A contingent is a set of people that are part of a larger group.
Example: The movie star stood in front of an entire contingent of photographers.

Definition: A deadline is the time by which you need to have something completed.
Example: Marius had a short deadline in which to finish his report.

Definition: To exert means to use strength or ability to do something.
Example: You exert a lot of energy when you lift weights.

Definition: To flank is to be positioned at the side of something or someone.
Example: The mayor entered the room flanked by her advisers.

Definition: To be fond of something means to cherish or like it.
Example: The mother cow was very fond of her lovely little calf.

Definition: To forbid means to order someone not to do something.
Example: After Robert used his crayons on the wall, his mother wanted to forbid him from using them at all!

Definition: To haul something means to carry it from place to place.
Example: The porter said he’d haul our suitcases up to our hotel room.

Definition: To impair something means to make it weaker or worse.
Example: Regularly eating too much can impair your health.

Definition: To be impatient means to get angry or anxious when something takes too much time.
Example: The impatient teacher could not control the students in her classroom.

Definition: Mid means in the middle or center of something.
Example: Cassandra fell asleep mid-movie.

Definition: Nutrition is the process of eating the right kind of food in order to stay healthy.
Example: The mother always made sure that her baby had good nutrition.

Definition: An optimist is someone who has a lot of hope and always sees the bright side of things.
Example: Joe was an optimist, so he believed he would get the job that he wanted.

Definition: A background is a person’s education, family, and experience.
Example: The new teacher had a background in science and math.

Definition: Bait is something used to trick a person or thing to do something.
Example: The best bait for catching fish is a big, fat worm.

Definition: To chronicle an event means to record it.
Example: The daily newspaper chronicles local and world events.

Definition: Copper is a red-brown metal often used in electric wire and pipes.
Example: Ancient hunters melted copper to make knives and spears.

Definition: A disease is an illness that causes specific problems.
Example: He had a disease that caused him to lose his hearing.

Definition: Folklore is the collection of beliefs and stories of a culture.
Example: India’s folklore has stories about great warriors written in long poems.

Definition: To infect someone means to give them an illness.
Example: The common cold infects hundreds of millions of people each year.

Definition: To itch means to have an unpleasant feeling that you want to scratch.
Example: The rough fabric in his shirt made his neck itch.

Definition: Literature is books, plays, and poetry.
Example: Early American literature covers the poetry and stories from 1500 to 1800.

Definition: A millennium is 1000 years.
Example: Stonehenge is believed to have been built about five millennia ago.

Definition: A myth is a traditional story that explains a culture’s history and beliefs.
Example: In Greece, there was a myth about a woman who had snakes for hair.

Definition: To promote someone means to raise them to a higher position or rank.

Definition: To relate to something means to have a connection with it.

Definition: A religion is a belief in a god or gods.
Example: Their religion taught that people should forgive their enemies.

Definition: A sum is a specific amount of money.

Definition: A teller is a person who works with a bank’s customers.

Definition: If someone is trustworthy, they are honest and truthful.

Definition: To update something means to make it more modern.

Definition: A vein is a tube in the body that carries blood toward the heart.

Definition: Venom is a poisonous substance that comes from animals or plants.

Definition: Charity is an act of giving help, usually money, to those who need it.

Definition: Commerce is the activity of buying and selling things.

Definition: To condemn someone means to give them a specific punishment.

Definition: If something is cozy, then it is comfortable, warm, and relaxing.

Definition: To deplete an amount of something means to use all of it up.

Definition: An economy is the money and businesses of a country or region.

Definition: An empire is a large group of countries ruled by an emperor or empress.

Definition: Goods are anything that can be bought or sold.

Definition: To heed something means to obey or follow it.

Definition: To hitchhike means to travel by asking for rides from passing vehicles.

Definition: To mock someone means to tease them in a cruel way.

Definition: If someone is neutral, then they do not help either of the two fighting sides.

Definition: Pity is the feeling of sadness and kindness for those who are suffering.

Definition: To reduce something means to make it smaller in size or fewer in number.

Definition: A scribe was a person whose job was to copy written works.

Definition: A temper is someone’s mood or a chance that they might get angry.

Definition: A throne is the special chair in which a ruler sits.

Definition: Unity is the state of people working together for a certain purpose.

Definition: A victor is a group or person that wins in a contest.

Definition: If something is accurate, it is completely correct.

Definition: To analyze something is to study it.

Definition: An asteroid is a giant rock from outer space.

Definition: A controversy is a dispute about something that affects many people.

Definition: To evolve is to change over time.

Definition: A factor is something that has an effect on the way another thing happens.

Definition: If something is genetic, it is related to the genes in one’s body.

Definition: A genome is the collection of all the genes in a living thing.

Definition: To be identical is to be the same as someone or something else.

Definition: An intellectual is a very smart person.

Definition: A majority of something is more than half of the people or things in that group.

Definition: A mammal is an animal that usually has hair and is not born from an egg.

Definition: To multiply is to increase in number.

Definition: Offspring are the children of a person or the babies of an animal.

Definition: A pesticide is a substance used to kill insects.

Definition: To regulate something is to control how it happens.

Definition: To reinforce something is to make it stronger.

Definition: If someone or something is stricken by a disease or problem, they are badly affected by it.

Definition: If something is vast, it is very large.

Definition: A vegetarian is someone who does not eat any meat products.

Definition: A bowl is a dish with a round deep shape.

Definition: Cooking food involves making it ready to eat.

Definition: If something is dense, it has a lot of things close together.

Definition: Dignity is the ability to be calm and worthy of respect.

Definition: To dominate someone or something is to control them.

Definition: If something is earthen, it is made of clay.

Definition: If someone is hostile, they are angry and unfriendly.

Definition: If something is incorrect, it is wrong.

Definition: Your intake of food is the amount of food you take into your body.

Definition: If someone does something likewise, they do the same thing as someone else.

Definition: A machine is made by people and does work for us.

Definition: Medication is medicine or drugs given to people who are sick.

Definition: If something is obscure, it is not well known.
Example: The old man travels the world in search of obscure books.

Definition: To oppress someone means to rule over them in a cruel and unfair way.

Definition: To peel fruits and vegetables is to remove their skin.

Definition: A prescription is permission from a doctor to get medicine.

Definition: When you make progress, you get better at what you are doing.

Definition: Sandy means covered with sand.

Definition: Shortage comes from short and means not having enough.

Definition: If someone is skillful at something, they are very good at doing it.

Definition: An aircraft is a vehicle that flies in the sky, such as an airplane or helicopter.

Definition: A celebrity is someone who is famous.
Example: It was the highlight of the evening when the celebrities arrived.

Definition: Concrete is a substance made from stones.
Example: The man covered the ground with concrete.

Definition: If someone is decisive, they make decisions quickly.

Definition: If someone is esteemed, many people like or respect them.
Example: An esteemed scientist is coming to the university to talk about his discoveries.

Definition: If something is ethical, it is the right thing to do.
Example: Many people believe that it is ethical to help others in need.

Definition: If plants or animals are extinct, there are none left.
Example: There used to be dinosaurs all over the world, but now they are extinct.

Definition: If a person or plant is hardy, it is strong and can live through difficult conditions.

Definition: An institute is an organization that is interested in research or teaching.

Definition: Jealousy is a feeling of wanting something that somebody else has.
Example: She felt a lot of jealousy when she saw her friend with a new car.

Definition: To migrate means to move from one place to another.

Definition: To nurture something means to care for it as it grows or develops.

Definition: If something is overhead, it is located above you.

Definition: A principle is a belief about the correct way to behave.

Definition: If a place is rural, it is in the countryside instead of the city.

Definition: If a place is secluded, it is far away from any other place.

Definition: A species is a type of plant or animal.

Definition: A swamp is a very wet area of land.

Definition: To traverse means to move or travel through an area.

Definition: Zoology is a subject in which people study animals.

Definition: If someone acts accordingly, they act in a way that is suitable.

Definition: An anchor is a heavy object dropped from a boat to make it stay in one place.

Definition: When you cause something, you make it happen.

Definition: Context is the situations that form the background of an event.

Definition: To designate someone or something means to give them a particular description.

Definition: To distort something means to lie about it, or pull or twist out of shape.

Definition: A dock is an enclosed area where ships go to be loaded, unloaded, and repaired.

Definition: If you have a lot of energy, you have plenty of strength and can do lots of things.

Definition: If something is frequent, then it happens or is done often.

Definition: The gears are the part of a motor that controls the speed.

Definition: When something is genuine, it is true or real.

Definition: Grease is an oily substance put on moving parts so they work smoothly, or oil or fat in cooking.

Definition: Knowledge is what you know.

Definition: When you omit something, you leave it out or do not do it.

Definition: When you have skill at doing a job, you are good at doing it.

Definition: A slot is a narrow opening in a machine or container.

Definition: A tactic is a careful plan to achieve something.

Definition: If something is beneficial, it is good for you.

Definition: A birthplace is a place where a person is born or where something started.

Definition: The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it.

Definition: If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else.

Definition: If something is comprehensive, it has all the details about something else.

Definition: To conserve something is to protect it from being ruined or used completely.

Definition: To deposit something is to put it into a place or another thing.

Definition: To distribute something is to give it to a number of people.

Definition: If something is federal, it relates to the government of a country.

Definition: A formation is the way that something is made.

Definition: Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe.

Definition: A rainforest is a forest that is in a place where it rains very often.

Definition: A strategy is a plan for how to do something.

Definition: If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees.

Definition: To expand is to become bigger in size.

Definition: If someone is incredulous about something, they do not believe that it is true.

Definition: To linger is to last for a long time.

Definition: An organism is a living thing, especially a very small one.

Definition: A shrine is a religious building built to honor a person, event, or god.

Definition: A candidate is a person who is competing to win something such as a job.

Definition: If something is confidential, it must be kept secret.

Definition: If something is corporate, it is related to a large business.

Definition: To enhance something is to make it better.

Definition: If two things are parallel, they are the same distance away from each other (along their entire length).

Definition: A territory is a piece of land that belongs to a country but isn’t a state.

Definition: Transportation is any type of vehicle that can carry people or things.

Definition: A telegraph is a method of sending electric messages on wires.

Definition: Textile is cloth that has been woven or knitted.

Definition: A tornado is a tube-shaped formation of air that spins very quickly.

Definition: A typhoon is a large tropical storm that moves in circles.

Definition: To wail is to show sadness by crying loudly.

Definition: A wardrobe is the collection of all of a person’s clothing.

Definition: Something that has an adverse effect can be harmful, dangerous, or unfavorable.

Definition: An alternate option is a different option.

Definition: When something is boxed, it is inside a package.

Definition: To discard something is to throw it away.

Definition: A dolphin is a large sea mammal that breathes air.

Definition: Ecologically means that something is done in a way that concerns living organisms and the environment.

Definition: The number of times something happens is the incidence of the event.

Definition: Overuse occurs when something is utilized too many times.

Definition: A pond is a freshwater body that is smaller than a lake.

Definition: When you recycle an object, you use its parts to make something else.

Definition: An object that is reusable can be utilized over and over again.

Definition: When something is stuffed, it is pushed into a small space.

Definition: A tragic event causes sadness because it might involve death or suffering.

Definition: To utilize something is to use it for a specific purpose.

Definition: A whale is a very large mammal that lives in the ocean.

Definition: An amateur is a person who does something for fun and isn’t paid for it.

Definition: If something is ambiguous, it is not entirely clear.

Definition: If someone is anonymous, no one knows who he or she is.

Definition: To attain something is to succeed at something or to get something you want.

Definition: Autonomy is another word for freedom or independence.

Definition: A concession is something that one person gives up to another.

Definition: Decay is the result of something slowly being broken down or destroyed naturally.

Definition: To dwell somewhere means to live there.

Definition: To enlighten someone is to teach them about something.

Definition: To enrich means to make someone rich or increase their wealth.

Definition: To flourish means to do very well and be in an excellent condition.

Definition: Geometry is the study of shapes and how to measure them.

Definition: To gleam means to sparkle and shine.

Definition: Indigenous means that something or someone exists naturally in an environment or area.

Definition: A parade is a series of things or people that come or are shown one after another.

Definition: A statue is a three-dimensional work of art, usually made of clay, marble, or metal.

Definition: A virgin is someone who has never had sex.

Definition: If something is abnormal, it is different from normal or average.

Definition: If someone or something is absent, they are missing or not in the place they are expected to be.

Definition: When something is adjacent, it is next to or adjoining something else.

Definition: Aluminum is a chemical element that is a light silver-coloured metal.

Definition: If something is applicable to a person or thing, it is relevant to them.

Definition: If something is artificial, it was not made naturally but mimics something natural.

Definition: A bicycle is a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling.

Definition: To broker is to arrange or negotiate the details of something for others.

Definition: A bureaucracy is a group of people who work together to help manage a large business or run a country.

Definition: To configure something means to set it up and arrange it.

Definition: To consolidate means to join or bring together into one thing.

Definition: If something is done for your convenience, it allows you to do something easily or without any trouble.

Definition: To deduct means to subtract something.
