Definition: To deem means to consider something.
Example: I deemed the ice cream to be very delicious.

Definition: An entrepreneur is someone who starts a new business or organization in order to make money.
Example: The entrepreneur made a success out of his new business.

Definition: If something is evenly spread or spaced, it is divided equally into amounts, numbers, or values.
Example: Sprinkle the sugar evenly all over the cookies.

Definition: When something is fiscal, it is related to money or finances, especially that of a government or business.
Example: Did the company show fiscal growth this year?

Definition: A franchise is the right to sell another company’s products or services in a particular area.
Example: The fast food restaurant has a franchise near my home.

Definition: If something is ideological, it is based on a system of beliefs or ideals, especially those that relate to a government or economy.
Example: The citizens of England had ideological differenes about its government.

Definition: A robot is a machine that can do the work of a person and operates automatically or is controlled by a computer.
Example: I bought a robot that can clean the floor on its own.

Definition: An abbey is a house, or group of houses, where monks or nuns live.
Example: When the monk returned to the abbey, he went immediately to his bedroom.

Definition: If something is abundant, then it is available in large quantities.
Example: Cakes, cookies, and candy were so abundant that the child was very happy.

Definition: To adjoin something means to be next to or attached to something else.
Example: She can listen to her brother’s conversations because her room adjoins his.

Definition: If something is ample, then it is enough or more than enough.
Example: There was an ample supply of oats to feed the horses.

Definition: If a place is arid, then it is hot and dry and gets very little or no rain.
Example: Not many plants grow in the arid desert.

Definition: A cathedral is an important, and often large and beautifully-built, church.
Example: The large cathedral is full of people on Sunday mornings.

Definition: A crisis is a difficult time when things are going to either get worse or better.
Example: The crisis was over and things returned to normal.

Definition: To deprive someone of something means to not let them have it.
Example: Because the child was bad, she was deprived of her dessert after dinner.

Definition: A drought is a long period of time in which little or no rain falls.
Example: After three months of drought, the vegetation and trees started dying.

Definition: If someone is eligible, then they are permitted to do or have something.
Example: Only people who bought tickets were eligible to win a prize.

Definition: To fast means to go without food or drink for a period of time.
Example: In her religion, they fast for five days and then have a big feast.

Definition: To grumble means to complain.
Example: He grumbled about having to work late on Friday.

Definition: If someone goes inland, they travel into the center of a country or land.
Example: The river curved inland near the campground.

Definition: Moisture is small drops of water in the air or on a surface.
Example: If you breathe on a window, moisture from your breath collects on the glass.

Definition: If something happens nonetheless, then it occurs despite some other thing.
Example: She tried to keep the dog out of the mud, but it got dirty nonetheless.

Definition: An oath is a formal, often public, promise.
Example: Judges must take an oath to be fair to everyone in court.

Definition: A prairie is a large flat area of grassland.
Example: The prairie was perfect for a farm because there were hills and trees.

Definition: If an area of land is rugged, then it is rocky and difficult to travel through.
Example: Their car couldn’t make it far along the rugged roads.

Definition: If something is scarce, then there is a very small amount of it.
Example: When gasoline was scarce, we rode our bike to school instead of driving.

Definition: To speculate means to guess about something.
Example: My sister looked at the sky and speculated that it would rain tomorrow.

Definition: If a plant or animal is aquatic, it lives or grows in water.
Example: The dolphin is an aquatic mammal.

Definition: The biosphere is the Earth’s surface and atmosphere where there are living things.
Example: Birds, trees, and worms all thrive in the biosphere.

Definition: When something is bizarre, it is very strange.
Example: My bizarre dreams make no sense to me when I am awake.

Definition: Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature.
Example: Water freezes at zero degrees Celsius.

Definition: If something is coarse, that means it has a rough texture.
Example: The coarse sweater made my skin itch.

Definition: A companion is a person that someone spends a lot of time with.
Example: I always walk to school with my companion Frank.

Definition: To digest means to swallow food and pass it through the body.
Example: Allow some time for food to be digested before going swimming.

Definition: The duration of an event is the time during which it happens.
Example: The girls watched television for the duration of the evening.

Definition: Ecology is the study of the environment and living things.
Example: We study ecology to learn how to help improve the Earth.

Definition: A feat is an impressive or difficult achievement or action.
Example: The elephant’s standing up on one leg was a feat.

Definition: If something is infinite, it has no limit or end.
Example: Many scientists believe that the universe is infinite.

Definition: The nucleus is the central part of an atom or cell.
Example: The nucleus is made up of many tiny particles.

Definition: A parasite is a tiny animal or plant that attaches to another animal to get food.
Example: The sick dog was covered in parasites.

Definition: When something is prominent, it is important and well known.
Example: Queen Victoria was a prominent person in history.

Definition: When something is repetitive, it is repeated many times and becomes boring.
Example: Working on an assembly line making cars every day is a repetitive job.

Definition: If something is reproductive, it is a living thing which can produce young.
Example: The reproductive system of a plant is simple.

Definition: When a place is temperate, it never gets too hot or cold.
Example: In Peru, the weather is temperate and rarely gets too hot or cold.

Definition: Tolerance is the ability to accept something unfavorable or to allow the freedom of choice for others.
Example: Boxers have a high tolerance for pain.

Definition: To undergo an action means to have it happen to you.
Example: The cancer patient undergoes treatments twice a week.

Definition: When someone is vulnerable, they are weak and without protection.
Example: He felt very vulnerable when he was stranded in the desert.

Definition: If something is archaic, it is very old or outdated.
Example: To be competitive, we must update our archaic equipment.

Definition: Brass is a metal that is used to make musical instruments and ornaments.
Example: Brass is used to make musical instruments like trumpets.

Definition: Capitalism is an economic system where private companies make goods for profit.
Example: Most economies in the world today are based on capitalism.

Definition: A component is a part of a larger machine.
Example: Computers have many different components, so they are complicated to build.

Definition: Dependence is a situation in which somebody relies on something else.
Example: Young children have a dependence on their parents.

Definition: To diminish means to reduce or get smaller.
Example: As the economy got worse, my savings diminished.

Definition: A drawback is a disadvantage.
Example: The drawback of having a car is that it is very expensive to maintain.

Definition: To impose means to interrupt or force your ideas on other people.
Example: He imposes on his wife every morning by expecting her to make his breakfast.

Definition: Industry is a kind of business that produces services or things for sale.
Example: The tourist industry is doing well all around the world.

Definition: Managerial describes something related to a manager or management.
Example: Nancy has a managerial position at the bank.

Definition: If something is medieval, it comes from the period between 650 and 1500 CE.
Example: We visited a castle that was built during medieval times.

Definition: If something is obsolete, it is not used anymore because something better exists.
Example: Since computers became inexpensive, typewriters have become obsolete.

Definition: When you are oriented towards something, you are faced in that direction.
Example: He is living a money-oriented lifestyle.

Definition: A peninsula is a large piece of land that is surrounded by the sea on three sides.
Example: The state of Florida is an example of a peninsula.

Definition: If a person has prestige, people admire or respect them.
Example: The young actress gained much prestige after she won an award.

Definition: A proportion is an amount that shows the link between the parts and the whole.
Example: Only a small proportion of the people in this town actually work here.

Definition: If something is radical, it is very new or different.
Example: The president is planning to make some radical changes to the law.

Definition: To refute something means to prove that it is false or incorrect.
Example: The bank manager has refuted the claims that he lied to his customers.

Definition: If something is spectacular, it looks or sounds very impressive.
Example: There was a spectacular fireworks display in the park at New Year.

Definition: To weave means to make cloth using horizontal and vertical threads.
Example: We saw a woman weave a blanket on our vacation to South America.

Definition: An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts for a business.
Example: The accountant helped us keep track of our spending.

Definition: A capitalist is a business person who invests in trade and industry for profit.
Example: The capitalist invested in a factory that made wheat into cereal.

Definition: Contempt is the feeling of having no respect for something.
Example: The judge had contempt for the wicked criminal.

Definition: A crop is something produced by the land.
Example: I had a good crop of onions this year.

Definition: To dedicate oneself to something means to put a lot of time and effort into it.
Example: The nun dedicated herself to helping people in need.

Definition: A ditch is a narrow hole cut into the ground by a road or a field.
Example: When the car slid off of the road, it fell into the ditch.

Definition: An enterprise is a company or business.
Example: My father owns an advertising enterprise.

Definition: To finance someone or something means to provide money for them.
Example: The government financed the scientist’s experiments with new weapons.

Definition: When someone is indifferent toward something, they have a lack of interest in it.
Example: Lisa is indifferent toward school. She doesn’t care what her final grades are.

Definition: To irrigate means to supply water to land so that crops can grow.
Example: In dry climates, it is important to irrigate fields of crops.

Definition: To maximize something is to make it as great as possible in amount, size, or importance.
Example: You should exercise regularly to maximize a healthy lifestyle.

Definition: When something is monetary, it relates to money.
Example: A strong monetary policy is important for a country to be successful.

Definition: A precaution is an action that is meant to stop something bad from happening.
Example: As a precaution, you should put on a heavy coat before going out in cold weather.

Definition: Preliminary describes something that happens before a more important event.
Example: The runners must do well in the preliminary races to qualify for the final race.

Definition: To saturate something means to completely soak it with a liquid.
Example: The sponge was saturated with soapy water and dripped all over the floor.

Definition: The simplicity of something is the fact that it is easy to do or understand.
Example: We were able to find the house thanks to the simplicity of the directions.

Definition: To sow seeds means to plant them in the ground.
Example: He always sows his garden seeds in the springtime.

Definition: A spade is a tool used for digging.
Example: The gardener used her spade to make a hole for the new plant.

Definition: A tomato is a round red fruit, but usually eaten as a vegetable. It’s often used in salads or pasta sauces.
Example: I like tomato sandwiches.

Definition: When something is upcoming, that means it will happen in the near future.
Example: The kids were worried about their upcoming exam.

Definition: Anthropology is the study of people, society, and culture.
Example: In anthropology class, I learned about simple tools that ancient cultures used.

Definition: To applaud means to clap in order to show approval.
Example: Everyone cheered and applauded Manny’s efforts.

Definition: To appoint someone to a job means to give the job to them.
Example: Two students were appointed to help the scientists with their research.

Definition: When things are compatible, they work well or exist together successfully.
Example: Jan and Fred are too different. They will never be compatible.

Definition: Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively.
Example: The job was easy because the group had enough competence to do it well.

Definition: To confer with someone means to discuss something with them to make a decision.
Example: I will have to confer with my wife before I can purchase a new car.

Definition: When things are consecutive, they happen one after another without interruption.
Example: The king ruled for ten consecutive years.

Definition: When something is crude, it is not exact or detailed but can still be useful.
Example: She drew crude hearts on the ground to show how much she loved him.

Definition: A cube is a solid object with six square surfaces that are all the same size.
Example: Please get me some ice cubes to put in my soda.

Definition: Feedback is comments to a person about how they are doing something.
Example: I asked my boss for feedback on my work.

Definition: Ignorance of something is lack of knowledge about it.
Example: When he failed the test, his ignorance of math was obvious.

Definition: When something is masculine, it is a quality or thing related to men.
Example: American football is usually considered a masculine sport.

Definition: A monument is a structure that is built to remind people of a person or event.
Example: A large monument was built to honor the brave soldiers.

Definition: When someone is muscular, they are very fit and strong.
Example: He exercised regularly so that his body could become muscular.

Definition: A person’s posture is the manner in which they stand or sit.
Example: Your back will feel better if you improve your posture.

Definition: To situate something means to place or build it in a certain place.
Example: The road was situated between the forest and the lake.

Definition: To supervise something means to make sure that it is done correctly.
Example: Allen supervised the construction workers to ensure everyone’s safety.

Definition: Symmetry is the state of having two halves that are exactly the same.
Example: The artist made sure to use perfect symmetry when painting the butterfly.

Definition: A tattoo is a design that is drawn permanently on the skin with needles.
Example: The surfer had tattoos on both his arms.

Definition: An undergraduate is a student at a college who is studying for a bachelor’s degree.
Example: She was excited to finish high school and enroll as an undergraduate in the fall.

Definition: To cater to someone means to provide them with all the things they need or want.
Example: Bill was too sick to get out of bed, so his nurse catered to his needs.

Definition: When someone is considerate, they pay attention to the needs of others.
Example: The considerate boy gave his girlfriend a present to cheer her up when she was sad.

Definition: The consumption of food or drink is the act of eating or drinking it.
Example: These apples are too rotten for consumption.

Definition: Criteria are factors on which a person judges or decides something.
Example: Before she got the job, she had to meet all the necessary criteria.

Definition: Crust is the tough outer part of a loaf of bread.
Example: The little boy never ate the crust of his pizza.

Definition: To entitle someone means to give them the right to have or do something.
Example: His golden ticket entitled him to sit in the front row at the concert.

Definition: To escort people means to safely accompany them to a place.
Example: Her bodyguards escorted her to the movie theater.

Definition: When something is external, it is connected to an outer part.
Example: It is warm inside my house, but the external temperature is freezing.

Definition: A facility is a building that exists for a particular purpose.
Example: There are many educational facilities in big cities.

Definition: A faculty is a mental or physical ability.
Example: The boy’s mental faculties impressed all of his teachers.

Definition: A heap of things is a large pile of them.
Example: After the building was torn down, all that was left was a heap of bricks.

Definition: A hemisphere is one half of the Earth.
Example: In the northern hemisphere, the weather is usually warmest in July and August.

Definition: A hound is a type of dog that is often used for racing or hunting.
Example: The men took their hounds with them when they went on the hunting trip.

Definition: If something is impersonal, it is not friendly and makes people feel unimportant.
Example: The boy felt scared on his first day at the big, impersonal high school.

Definition: When you lick something, you pass your tongue over it.
Example: He licked his ice cream before it melted.

Definition: An ornament is an attractive object that people display in their homes.
Example: The woman kept some colorful ornaments on the shelves.

Definition: A pedestrian is a person who is walking on a street.
Example: Drivers should be careful when pedestrians are walking around.

Definition: A sanctuary is a place where people in danger can go to be safe.
Example: The church was made into a sanctuary for homeless people in the winter.

Definition: A spectator is someone who watches something, for example, a sports event.
Example: There were thousands of spectators at the big game.

Definition: When you yell at someone, you shout at them.
Example: Someone yelled out his name.

Definition: An accessory is a thing that is added to another thing to make it look better.
Example: The store sold colorful accessories like bags, sunglasses, and makeup.

Definition: An acquisition is something that a person buys or gets in some way.
Example: Marty was happy with his new acquisition: a very fast bicycle.

Definition: Cardboard is a material made out of stiff paper. It is often used to make boxes.
Example: We packed our things into cardboard boxes and moved to our new home.

Definition: A dilemma is a difficult situation in which a choice has to be made.
Example: Choosing either the tastier or healthier drink proved to be quite a dilemma.

Definition: When something is elaborate, it contains a lot of details.
Example: She gave the teacher an elaborate explanation of her project.

Definition: Exact means correct in every detail.
Example: I know the exact location of the restaurant you mentioned before.

Definition: To facilitate something is to make it easier.
Example: To facilitate the meeting, Melissa used a simple computer program.

Definition: A fleet is a group of ships.
Example: The fleet of ships spent a few days at the dock.

Definition: A grid is a pattern of squares with numbers and letters to find places on a map.
Example: We located our town using the grid.

Definition: To import means to bring in a product from another country.
Example: Foods that have been imported are usually more expensive.

Definition: To infer something is to decide it is true based on other information one has.
Example: By the position of the sun in the sky, she inferred that it was noon.

Definition: To inflate something means to fill it up with air.
Example: I helped him inflate the balloons.

Definition: When something is innate, it is something that one is born with and was not learned.
Example: He had the innate desire to please his teachers.

Definition: Marble is a type of rock that feels cold and is smooth when cut.
Example: The large house had floors made of marble.

Definition: A mast is a long pole on a ship that holds the sail.
Example: The mast held both sails of the ship upright.

Definition: Nausea is the feeling of being sick to your stomach.
Example: The doctor said the medicine would help get rid of her nausea.

Definition: When something is naval, it relates to a country’s navy or military ships.
Example: The country sent all of its naval forces to protect them.

Definition: A pouch is a small, flexible bag that is usually made of soft material.
Example: I keep my money in a small pouch.

Definition: If something is saturated, it is completely wet.
Example: Leigh’s hair became saturated in the rainstorm.

Definition: An update is an act of making something more modern or current.
Example: My phone is downloading a software update.

Definition: An attorney is one who gives others advice about the law.
Example: The attorney appeared in front of the judge for me.

Definition: When something is chronic, it happens over and over again for a long time.
Example: He had chronic pain in his chest and needed to see a doctor.

Definition: Discipline is training that helps people follow the rules.
Example: One of the teacher’s jobs is to teach her students discipline.

Definition: A donor is somebody who gives something to an organization.
Example: He was proud to be a blood donor.

Definition: A fellow is someone who shares a job or quality with someone else.
Example: All of my fellow patients at the hospital have also complained about the food.

Definition: Gossip is information that might be untrue but is still discussed anyway.
Example: The friends exchanged gossip about the people they knew in school.

Definition: To graduate from a school means to complete and pass all courses of study there.
Example: At the end of the spring, my friends and I will graduate from high school.

Definition: Graffiti is words or drawings in public places.
Example: The wall was covered with colorful graffiti.

Definition: A guardian is someone who protects somebody or something.
Example: The librarians are the guardians of the books.

Definition: To implicate someone is to show that they have done a crime or something bad.
Example: The man was implicated in the theft at the store.

Definition: Kin is a person’s family and relatives.
Example: His kin were all farmers.

Definition: A referee is a person who makes sure that the rules are followed in sports.
Example: The soccer player didn’t agree with the referee.

Definition: To sever something is to cut through it completely.
Example: He severed the string using scissors.

Definition: A shaft is a handle of a tool or weapon.
Example: The golf club had a long wooden shaft that he held in his hands.

Definition: To stab means to cut with the end of a sharp object like a knife.
Example: He stabbed the fork into the potato and passed it to his daughter.

Definition: A stimulus is something that causes growth or activity.
Example: Having a lot of money is a stimulus for people to buy more things.

Definition: A suspicion is a feeling that something is possible or true in a crime.
Example: The police had a suspicion that the driver had stolen the purse.

Definition: To terminate something means to stop or end it.
Example: The trip was terminated after the car broke down.

Definition: A theme is the main subject of a book, movie, or painting.
Example: The students discussed the book’s theme in class.

Definition: Tuition is the amount of money paid to go to a school.
Example: University tuitions have increased by 50 percent in the last five years.

Definition: If someone is aggressive, then they constantly want to fight or argue.
Example: Nobody liked to play games with him because he was always too aggressive.

Definition: Amnesty is a pardon given to prisoners of war.
Example: She was denied amnesty for her involvement in the war.

Definition: An arena is a building where people can watch sports and concerts.
Example: The new arena was all set to hold the championship match.

Definition: An auditorium is a large building used for public events.
Example: People have gathered at the school auditorium to watch the play.

Definition: A captive is a prisoner.
Example: The guards told the captive that there was no way he could escape the prison.

Definition: Combat is fighting between two people or groups.
Example: The two warriors were locked in combat.

Definition: If something is commonplace, then it is ordinary.
Example: There is nothing commonplace about the way Morris dresses.

Definition: A compound is an enclosed area such as a prison or factory.
Example: The workers waited outside the compound for the gates of the factory to open.

Definition: A corps is a division of a military force.
Example: The army had a corps of archers who trained apart from the regular soldiers.

Definition: To distract someone means to stop them from concentrating on something.
Example: The phone call distracted him so much that he forgot all about his homework.

Definition: If someone is dumb, they are unable to speak.
Example: She did not share the secret. She remained as silent as if she were dumb.

Definition: A foe is an enemy or opponent.
Example: It was hard to believe that anyone could be his foe.

Definition: To hack something means to cut it into uneven pieces.
Example: My uncle used the ax to hack the tree into many logs.

Definition: To meditate means to focus or think deeply in silence.
Example: She liked to meditate for several hours each day.

Definition: To nick something or someone means to cut them slightly with a sharp object.
Example: While cutting the carrots, the cook nicked his finger with the edge of his knife.

Definition: To provoke someone means to annoy them on purpose to cause violence.
Example: The older boy provoked Paul by calling him mean names.

Definition: A realm is any area of activity or interest.
Example: He was not very active in the realm of business.

Definition: A reign is the period of time in which a ruler rules.
Example: The emperor’s reign lasted for only two years.

Definition: Rust is a red and brown coating on iron objects caused by water and air.
Example: The old metal gate would not swing because the hinges were covered in rust.

Definition: If something is sacred, then it is worshipped and respected.
Example: One religion in India will not harm cows because it believes that they are sacred.

Definition: If something is aesthetic, then it is concerned with a love of beauty.
Example: The dresses were noteworthy for their aesthetic design.

Definition: If someone is arrogant, they think that they are more important than others.
Example: He is very arrogant. Even though he’s not the boss, he tells everyone what to do.

Definition: A bias is a person’s likelihood to like one thing more than another thing.
Example: The mothers had a natural bias for their own child’s picture.

Definition: A canyon is a narrow valley with steep walls through which a river often flows.
Example: The canyon was so deep that the ground inside was covered in shadow.

Definition: A creek is a stream or small river.
Example: Only small fish lived in the shallow waters of the creek.

Definition: A drill is a tool with a point that spins in order to make a hole.
Example: The carpenter used the drill to make several holes in the wood.

Definition: An executive is the top manager of a business.
Example: After twenty years at the company, he finally became the executive.

Definition: Fatigue is a feeling of extreme tiredness.
Example: After three days with little sleep, she was feeling a lot of fatigue.

Definition: An incline is a sharp rise in something, especially a hill or mountain.
Example: This mountain has one of the steepest inclines in the world.

Definition: If something is nasty, then it is not nice or pleasant.
Example: The rotten apple left a nasty taste inside her mouth.

Definition: To perceive something means to be aware of it.
Example: He was talking loudly, so he did not perceive that the music had stopped.

Definition: A primate is a type of mammal that includes monkeys, apes, and humans.
Example: Primates use their hands for such tasks as swinging from branches.

Definition: If something is primitive, then it is simple, basic, and not very developed.
Example: The computers of the 1980s are primitive compared to those of today.

Definition: A stereotype is a general but often incorrect idea about a person or thing.
Example: There’s a stereotype that pigs are dirty animals. But they are rather clean.

Definition: If something is sticky, then it is covered with a substance that things stick to.
Example: Place the sticky part of the tape against the paper, so it will cling to the wall.

Definition: A termite is an insect that lives in groups and feeds on wood.
Example: The wood we found was full of termites.

Definition: If we say that thereby something happens, we mean it is a result of something else.
Example: He didn’t score a goal, thereby ending his chance at setting a record.

Definition: A trail is a path for travelling by foot through a wild area.
Example: A narrow trail cut through the field and over the hills.

Definition: A twig is a short and thin branch from a tree or bush.
Example: They started the fire with a handful of dry twigs.

Definition: Welfare is the health and happiness of a person or group.
Example: Having plenty of clean water is necessary for the welfare of people.

Definition: If something is done on one’s behalf, it is done for that person by another.
Example: The original speaker was sick, so his son gave the speech on his behalf.

Definition: To flap means to move quickly up and down or from side to side.
Example: The tiny bird flapped its wings and ate from the flowers.

Definition: A glacier is a large piece of ice that moves very slowly.
Example: The North Pole is covered by a huge glacier.

Definition: The globe refers to the Earth.
Example: Water covers most of the globe.

Definition: When something is horizontal, it is fat and level with the ground.
Example: The Russian fag has three horizontal stripes of white, blue, and red.

Definition: To hum means to make a low, continuous noise.
Example: The man hummed his favorite song.

Definition: An inventory is a supply of something.
Example: Gwen was checking the inventory to make sure we had what we needed.

Definition: If a thought or feeling is inward, it is not expressed or shown to others.
Example: She had an inward feeling of guilt when she lied to her mother.

Definition: A loaf of bread is bread shaped and baked in one piece.
Example: Could you please buy a loaf of bread for sandwiches?

Definition: An oracle is a person who speaks with gods and gives advice about the future.
Example: The king went to the oracle to ask if going to war was a good idea.

Definition: To orbit something means to move around it in a continuous, curving path.
Example: The Moon orbits the Earth.

Definition: An overview is a general description of a situation.
Example: My brother gave me an overview of the important parts of the book.

Definition: A preview is an opportunity to see something before it is available to the public.
Example: The band played us a preview of their new song.

Definition: If something is previous, then it happened earlier in time or order.
Example: He turned back to the previous page to read the paragraph again.

Definition: To provide something means to supply it.
Example: Each student was provided with a test and three sharp pencils.

Definition: To recur means to happen more than once.
Example: Burglaries seem to recur over and over in our neighborhood.

Definition: When something is relevant, it is important to a certain person or situation.
Example: The 30-year-old book about politics is still relevant to our society today.

Definition: A rite is a traditional ceremony carried out by a particular group or society.
Example: Special masks are worn during the rite when a new baby is born.

Definition: To stall means to stop a process and continue it at a later time.
Example: If you give the car a push, it won’t stall.

Definition: If something is supernatural, it is not real or explainable by laws of nature.
Example: The dragon had supernatural powers, such as flying and breathing fire.

Definition: An aquarium is a place where fish and underwater animals are kept.
Example: We took a trip to the aquarium and saw a scary shark.

Definition: If something is arbitrary, it is not based on any plan or system, so it seems random.
Example: The classroom had many arbitrary rules that confused me.

Definition: An autobiography is a true story of a person’s life written by that person.
Example: I read an autobiography about my favorite entertainer.

Definition: A convention is behavior that is considered to be common or polite.
Example: In the US, a popular convention is to shake hands when you meet someone.

Definition: If someone is gracious, then they are kind and helpful to those who need it.
Example: The operator was gracious enough to help me find the number.

Definition: To improve something means to make it better.
Example: He studied hard to improve his test scores from the previous year.

Definition: To insulate something means to protect it from heat, cold, or noise.
Example: People can conserve energy by insulating their houses.

Definition: To intrigue means to cause an interest in something or someone.
Example: Her mysterious past intrigued her new friend.

Definition: Longevity is the ability to live for a long time.
Example: Sea turtles have an amazing longevity.

Definition: To misplace something means to lose it.
Example: I misplaced my wallet, and I didn’t find it until a week later.

Definition: When children are naughty, they behave badly or do not do what they are told.
Example: The boy had to go to his room because he was being naughty.

Definition: A norm is a way of behaving that is considered normal in a particular society.

Definition: A coward is a person who lacks courage to do risky or dangerous things.
Example: A firefighter cannot be a coward. They have to be able to act quickly.

Definition: To delete something means to remove or erase written material.
Example: Several lines had been deleted from her speech.

Definition: If someone is earnest, then they are honest.
Example: The child was very earnest when she told her mother how she broke the dish.

Definition: If something is ethnic, then it is related to a group with a similar culture.
Example: Many sections of the city are home to different ethnic communities.

Definition: To exclude someone means to not accept them into a group.
Example: Carol was excluded from the contest because her friend was a judge.

Definition: If something is firsthand, then it is from an original source.
Example: If you want firsthand knowledge, ask someone who saw it.

Definition: If someone is fluent in a language, then they are able to speak it very well.
Example: She was so fluent in German that you’d have thought she was from Germany.

Definition: If something is imperial, then it is related to an empire.
Example: These old imperial coins were once used in the Roman Empire.

Definition: If something is inclusive, then it is open to all groups and people in society.
Example: A more inclusive event would have allowed children to attend.

Definition: A legislature is the section of a government that makes laws.
Example: The senator had served ten years in the national legislature.

Definition: If something is linguistic, then it is concerned with language.
Example: A linguistic way of studying culture focuses on words within that culture.

Definition: If someone is monolingual, then they speak only one language.
Example: In today’s global economy, being monolingual limits your opportunities.

Definition: Nationality is an identity based on the nation from which you come.
Example: His nationality is German, but he speaks French, Spanish, and Korean.

Definition: A patriot is someone who loves, supports, and defends their country.
Example: Every year, young patriots join their countries’ militaries.

Definition: To prosecute someone means to take legal action against them.
Example: They were prosecuted for fishing in the river without a permit.

Definition: If something is racial, then it is related to a race or races.
Example: The differences between racial groups are physical characteristics and culture.

Definition: If something is solemn, then it is serious and honest.
Example: The professor preferred a solemn relationship between him and his students.

Definition: Solidarity is a union formed from common responsibilities or interests.
Example: All the citizens came together in a show of solidarity to create change.

Definition: Tact is the ability to avoid offending people when dealing with problems.
Example: Since both sides would not agree, it required someone with tact to make peace.

Definition: To undermine someone means to betray them or weaken their efforts or authority.
Example: The documents helped to undermine the workers’ trust in their bosses’ honesty.

Definition: To constrain something means to limit its development.
Example: Jim cannot join us because he is constrained by previous plans.

Definition: A depot is a bus or train station.
Example: He waited for his mother to arrive at the depot.

Definition: To emulate people means to imitate them because they are greatly admired.
Example: As a small boy, he always tried to emulate his big brother.

Definition: The forefinger is the finger between one’s thumb and middle finger.
Example: He shouted, “There it is!” and pointed with his forefinger.

Definition: The guts are all the organs inside a person or animal.
Example: The doctor can tell you every process that happens in one’s guts.

Definition: When something is inherent, it is a natural part of something else.
Example: Sweating is an inherent bodily function when exercising.

Definition: To intimidate means to frighten others.
Example: My dad intimidates my friends whenever they visit.

Definition: A janitor is a person who makes repairs and takes care of a building.
Example: The school janitor cleaned up the messy cafeteria.

Definition: When something is moist, it is slightly wet.
Example: The ground is still moist from the rain last night.

Definition: Nope is an informal way of saying “no.”
Example: He asked if I had any money, and I had to say, “Nope.”

Definition: To prod means to push someone or something with a finger or pointed object.
Example: The bully prodded me in the chest with her finger.

Definition: A ransom is a sum of money paid to a kidnapper to set the person free.
Example: He kidnapped the prince and demanded $1 million as a ransom.

Definition: To restrain someone or something means to use physical strength to stop them.
Example: Mike restrained Allen from reaching the door.

Definition: Saliva is the watery liquid in people’s mouths that helps in digestion.
Example: The baby could not keep the saliva from dripping out of its mouth.

Definition: To spit means to force liquid from one’s mouth.
Example: He emerged from the pool and spit water from his mouth.

Definition: To sprint means to run very fast over a short distance.
Example: The kids didn’t want to be late to class, so they sprinted to the bus stop.

Definition: A stunt is something that is done in order to get attention or publicity.
Example: The man jumped over the cars as a promotional stunt.

Definition: When people are tolerant, they are respectful of others’ rights and beliefs.
Example: The tolerant leader thought that everyone was equal regardless of race.

Definition: A vampire is a fictional monster that sleeps in a coffin and sucks people’s blood.
Example: The vampire snuck up on the woman and bit her neck.

Definition: To yawn means to open one’s mouth wide and breathe in air.
Example: The child yawned and stretched her arms before going to bed for the night.

Definition: If something is adjoining, it is next to or joined with a building or room.
Example: I couldn’t sleep because the people in the adjoining room were loud.

Definition: To allege something is to say that it is true without offering proof.
Example: The little girl had alleged that her older brother hid her favorite doll.

Definition: An arch is a curved opening formed under a structure such as a bridge or doorway.
Example: The arch of the bridge was not high enough for the tall boat to pass underneath.

Definition: To assemble means to get together in one place.
Example: The parents assembled to discuss ways to improve their children’s education.

Definition: A casualty is a person killed or injured in a war or an accident.
Example: The only casualty in the car accident was a woman who broke her arm.

Definition: To erect something means to build it.
Example: The king erected two towers on the north and south sides of his castle.

Definition: If something is foul, then it is very unpleasant.
Example: He wouldn’t let his dog drink from the water because it had a foul smell.

Definition: A hectare is a unit of measure equal to 10,000 square meters.
Example: His family farm covered many hectares.

Definition: To heighten an emotion means to increase the intensity of it.
Example: The pleasant music heightened their enjoyment of the wonderful dinner.

Definition: Hospitality is friendly behavior and entertainment, shown to guests or strangers.
Example: The travelers were amazed at the hospitality given them by the hotel’s staff.

Definition: A mansion is a large and expensive home.
Example: The mansion had thirty bedrooms, two kitchens, and a pool.

Definition: To outnumber a group means to have a greater number than it.
Example: The girls outnumbered the boys at the school by four to one.

Definition: If someone is overjoyed, then they are extremely happy.
Example: He was overjoyed by the news of his promotion.

Definition: A pasture is an area of land covered with grass for animals to use as food.
Example: The sheep were taken to a pasture where there was more grass.

Definition: A petition is a written request asking an authority to do something.
Example: The citizens all signed a petition asking the mayor to repair the sidewalks.

Definition: To renovate a building means to repair it, or to build new structures on it.
Example: The old fire station was renovated into an apartment building.

Definition: To revise something means to change it, or update it to make it better.
Example: When the editor discovered certain facts were wrong, he revised the book.

Definition: A slab is a large, thick, flat piece of stone, concrete, metal, or wood.
Example: I looked at various slabs of stone to decorate my house.

Definition: A terrace is an open area that is connected to a house or an apartment.
Example: In the afternoons, she liked to sit on the terrace and check her email.

Definition: Turf is a section of grass and the dirt in which it grows.
Example: After the game, the turf looked ragged.

Definition: If something is analogous to another thing, then it is like it in certain ways.
Example: The relationship with his teacher was analogous to that of a son and mother.

Definition: Binoculars are a device used for seeing things that are far away.
Example: He could see the ship on the horizon only if he used his binoculars.

Definition: The bulk of something is its size.
Example: The large elephant moved its bulk with legs as strong as tree trunks.

Definition: If something comprises something else, it consists of or is made up of it.
Example: Our school’s football team is mostly comprised with seniors.

Definition: To depict something means to show or portray it, often using art.
Example: The statue’s face depicted the general’s determination and courage.

Definition: If something is dual, then it is made up of two parts.
Example: The room had a dual function. It was a living room, but at night it was a bedroom.

Definition: Fahrenheit is a temperature scale where water freezes at 32° and boils at 212°.
Example: When the temperature dropped to 32° Fahrenheit, it started snowing.

Definition: To fulfill something means to achieve or finish it.
Example: The professor did not fulfill his promise not to miss a single class.

Definition: A grove is a small group of trees.
Example: All the trees in this grove are apple trees.

Definition: Ore is the raw form of rock or material from which a valuable metal is taken.
Example: The factory melted the ore and used it to make iron products.

Definition: The outback is the wild inland region of Australia where very few people live.
Example: Many Australian farmers use the outback to raise cattle.

Definition: To outweigh something means to exceed it in value, amount, or importance.
Example: Finding a warm place to sleep outweighed the need to find something to eat.

Definition: A paradox is a true statement or real event that seems illogical.
Example: The paradox of her work was that the less she worked, the more she got done.

Definition: A pier is a structure that extends into a body of water.
Example: If you want to catch bigger fish, then go to the far end of the pier.

Definition: A shortcut is a route that is shorter than the main route.
Example: We got to the house early because we took a shortcut through the forest.

Definition: A tariff is a tax or fee paid on certain imports or exports.
Example: Our tariff on imported wool makes foreign wool more expensive.

Definition: A thermometer is a device that measures temperature.
Example: The thermometer outside the window indicated that it was a hot day today.

Definition: To tilt something means to tip it into a sloping position.
Example: She tilted her glass and almost spilled some of the wine inside.

Definition: If a statement is vice versa, then its two main ideas are switched with one another.
Example: Students learn from their teachers, and vice versa.

Definition: The whereabouts of someone or something is the place where they are.
Example: The police looked for the lost dog, but its whereabouts were still unknown.
